Reviews.Title: “what a find”
Reviews.Author: kath w
Reviews.Content: i have been to new york 5 times and stayed at the new yorker or pensylvania hotels.booked this holiday inn last july through british airways due to the unbelievable offer i got the flight & hotel for £560.my 2 daughters myself and 3yr old grandson arrived march 26th and boy we thought omg the street looks rough.but the hotel is spotless.rooms are small but hey you only sleep in them so what does it matter.we were at the back of hotel so no noise at night so we slept soundly until grandson woke us up at 3am due to his body still being on uk time.the free breakfast was a bonus and changed daily in the hot section.saved us a few dollars so we would recomend this hotel to all unless your the sort who moan about room size.if we can get the same deal again we will be returning again and again.oh and not to forget the check in gentleman.polite well dressed and so helpfull.well done holiday inn.

Reviews.Title: “Superb find - Excellent unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: PennyRon
Reviews.Content: Our first visit into the city of New York and have to say that staying here at this brilliant hotel made our vislt to this fabulous city all the more enjoyable. Quiet street in the best of locations. ALL the staff we met were superb, very polite and could not have been more helpful. Free internet 24 hrs a day, complimentary coffee and tea in the lounge area, free use of the gym and great complimentary hot breakfast, lots of seating outside on the patio area. We stayed here for 4 nights and could not have been more happy with our choice of hotel. Within walking distance of all the major attractions close to Macy's, Madisson Square Garden, Empire State building, (view from our bedroom window), Chrysler Building. Grand Central station, Times Square, and both the underground and Penn Station. Loads of places to eat nearby. We walked from the hotel to Central Park and to the other end of the island to the 9/11 memorial and Staten Island Ferry. Twin and double rooms avaialble all with en suites which have baths and showers and complimentary toiletries available should you forget something, wi-fi in all rooms good quality beds and tv's. We caught the airtrain from JFK airport to Jamaica, last stop on the airtrain at the airport and then the Long Island Rail Road train from Jamaica Hub to Penn Station about a 1/2 hr ride. Penn station is located 2 blocks from the hotel on 31st . So easy to access and very easy ride directly from the airport to the centre of the city. Cost $5 for the airtrain ticket, payable as you enter or exit the airtrain at Jamaica, and $6 for the LIRR train ride. We caught the underground from Penn Station on the E line back to Jamaica - Sutphin Boulevard $2.25 then airtrain $5 back to the airport, would recommend the LIRR train which was much quicker due to the stops on the subway, felt safe but was crowed on the underground. Thanks to all at the hotel for making our stay so pleasant cannot recommend highly enough, we loved our stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Alina G
Reviews.Content: Stay for 4 days during the toy fair after a long and exhausting day it was wonderful to find our room and bathroom spotless. The area was close to many eateries. My daughter and I felt safe and enjoyed a good night sleep. The complimentary breakfast was great. I must compliment Frank Vick of guest services he was extremely pleasant, funny and yet professional. He was also very helpful with recommendations. Clone this guy! He is an asset to the company. Thank you Frank for making our stay A+.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: JollyHenceforth
Reviews.Content: There is a nightclub near this place that is open on Thursday thru Sunday so each night I stayed here all I heard at night was loud music and thumping base. This is the case even though I was on the seventh floor. Also, just like most Manhattan hotels, the rooms are very small, which was expected. My room, however, was so small that it did not even have a closet. The television, apparently, had been pulled from the wall, so there were holes in the wall. I reserved a double room, but when I got there, none were available so they brought up a cot for me to sleep on. This would have been ok but the cot was very rough and I am still feeling the springs in my back. On the other hand, unlike several reviewers, I found the staff to be very nice and helpful. Also, the location is great. It is two blocks from Madison Square Garden so, if you are going to a Rangers or Knicks game, there is no better place to stay. It is also fairly short walk to shopping and a little longer walk to the theatre district and Times Square. So, if you plan to be out partying all night yourself, disregard the noise and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Noisiest hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: William R
Reviews.Content: We stayed here four nights and it was like living in a gymnasium. Shouting, drunken sports fans from Madison Square Garden events and busloads of shouting, screaming high school kids made the nights terrible. We caught some time to sleep between 1 a.m and 6 a.m. then the noise started again. The doors are noisy (it is almost impossible to quietly open or close them) and everyone seemed to slam them at every opportunity. The hallways are like sound amplifiers and it seemed like everyone on our floor loved to shout at everyone else on the floor. The walls are paper thin, so there is just no escaping the noise. I've lived in quieter Army barracks. The rooms are OK, but we did notice that the chest of drawers under the TV was only dusted in front. You could see layers of dust a hands length further back. We will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be returning...”
Reviews.Author: Claire K
Reviews.Content: Just enjoyed a lovely 4 night stay at the Holiday Inn Express. It was my first trip to New York and loved every second. Hotel was in a fantastic location and staff friendly and helpful. Special mention to the young man on the door (wears glasses, not sure of his name sorry) who always went out of his way to help us, especially with hailing taxi's! Room was cleaned everyday, toiletries and coffee making facilities provided and also a hairdryer, iron and ironing board. Also liked that there was a choice of pillows, firm or soft :) Will definitely be returning... Thankyou for an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sooo close to Madison Square Garden!”
Reviews.Author: hockeylaxandcheermom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn Express March 6-7 to attend a Big East basketball game at Madison Square Garden - great location. Staff was very friendly and accomodating - they even stored our luggage after we checked-out so we could see a matinee show before heading home - nice breakfast in lobby! Although room was somewhat small, beds and pillows were very comfortable - an alarm clock or a little fridge would of been nice to have in the room. Valet parking was $40 + tax for 24 hrs. Although there is not a restaurant in the hotel, there are many close by. Would definately stay here again when attending an event at MSG.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located for a shopping trip in New York”
Reviews.Author: michel_josee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located at the best location for anyone who like to spend good time in midtown Manhatan...perfect distance from Time Square for a healthy walk after diner, close enough to Tribeca, Greenwhich village and Union Square for a great shopping experience. Dont miss outstanding stores like Allsaints Splitafields for great clothes, or Eddy Fish for exclusive dishes to bring baack home. The hotel is very clean, rooms are big enough for a Manhatan hotel, breakfast area is very well lit and roomy as well as the terrace outside which is great if you prefer to have breakfast outside...this is my ew favrotie hotel in Manhatan for now,,,better than the one on 5th I think...

Reviews.Title: “good convenient location”
Reviews.Author: beentherejohn
Reviews.Content: Very nice property with clean, well maintained rooms. Desk staff very friendly and helpful. This hotel is only a five minute walk from Penn Station and a quick walk to the subway so a quite convenient location. Very good price in comparison to other similar hotels near times square and on the west side.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean but small”
Reviews.Author: lenzy484
Reviews.Content: I will start with my only negative comment: the rooms are SO tiny. But I understand it's NYC and most are. So if you can handle that, then the hotel is nice. It was clean, comfortable beds, the breakfast was always being restocked and the location was perfect. You have two subway options, one one block away and another about three. MSG is simple to walk to, as is Macy's. We walked to Times Square but it was a decent hike. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: sbdaugaard
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff. Room was clean but a bit noisy I guess the low price attract the young crowd. Very good if you need a place to stay in the city but do not plan to spend much time in the hotel. The staff hold on to our luggage after check-out with no charge, which gave us another day in the city. I thought that was a nice gesture for a low cost hotel. Location is excellent, walking distance to Penn Station and MSG, and very close to subway stations. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Scando2
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly. Room was super clean. Lacked any furnishings for luggage. The bathroom was small and very nice, but had zero vanity space and basically no where to hang towels and clothing. The restaurant and lounge is very dark - no natural light. A decent value for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent visit!”
Reviews.Author: Reaku68
Reviews.Content: Was in NYC for Toy Fair. Hotel was close to event and Madison Square Garden. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very good with good variety each morning. It is great that it is a pet friendly hotel. I only wish there was a soda machine available. Overall though, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good for budget travel not recommended for business”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo F
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here just because my company is cheap enough to not put me in a better hotel. With that said, this hotel is not bad at all, but there are a few things to be aware of. The breakfast is extremely crowded in the morning, if you are in a rush, skip it and go somewhere else. People having breakfast are usually tourists which don't care about time. I have stayed in two different rooms at this hotel, both had stains on the carpet. The wi-fi is horrible and don't expect it to work with Android devices. You call the unhelp desk and they don't help you at all. I am an IT professional and they claim I don't know how to configure my device (yeah right). The location is great, 5 minutes to Penn Station and accessible to a few subway stations. Do not, again, do not use their car service company. It is a total rip off and they charge you hidden fees that are only disclosed when you arrive at the destination and have no way to back out of the service. The TV is LCD but no HD service, I don't understand why hotels do that. In a nutshell.... if you are looking for cheap lodging in NYC which is close to everything and free breakfast, go for it. I would not come here in a business travel, unless your company is too cheap to put you somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “couple from belfast feb 2012”
Reviews.Author: Nicky G
Reviews.Content: this hotel was excellent. very well situated for sightseeing in manhattan. very clean friendly staff, great b&b 24/7 tea and coffee. highly recommended hope to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Good overnight stop”
Reviews.Author: Jessy1021
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and big enough for 4 people. We asked for 2 double beds but ended up with a queen. The hotel staff resolved this by giving us a roll-away bed which wasn't too bad. Hotel staff was friendly. They could keep breakfast open for a bit longer. By the time we got downstairs they were packing it up already (around 9:45) The heat was a little wacky as it kept blowing out cold air instead of warm air. We had it up to 78 and it was still a bit cool! Otherwise, it was a pleasant stay. Good location, decent price. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and nice, great location”
Reviews.Author: AJT5
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the Holiday Inn Express before catching a train to Montreal. The nice ladies at the front desk upgraded us! The room was clean and comfortable and the location was wonderful! Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel...but dont expect requests to be met”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey T
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 rooms for this past weekend & only had one request. Please put them on the same floor. Very simple & they did the complete opposite. Every room was on a seperate floor & I really did not appreciate the lack of effort for one little thing. Even if you are close to sold out you should try to honor requests as they come in, whether it be over the phone or otherwise stated. If not please inform the guest why you couldn't meet the request. I work for another Holiday Inn & we do everything in our power to fill requests as people call us, for any date we can. Besides the tiny rooms, everything else was fine. Just wish staff could have acted like they cared about my request.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Good Rates, Easy Access to NYC”
Reviews.Author: rwoman11
Reviews.Content: Location: This property is on 29th street, between 7th and 8th. It is a short walk from Penn Station and I found 8th Street to be slightly less congested. Keep in mind that events at MSG can make the area very busy, especially if walking with bags. The hotel is easy walking distance to Herald Square, Times Square, MSG, etc. Its location also makes for easy access to the various Subway lines, PATH trains, and regional trains. There are abundant places to eat and drink nearby - pubs, bars, Italian, fast food...just about everything! Check In: Check in was fairly painless although I had to get a different room because the first one was still being cleaned when I went upstairs. As a PC Platinum member, they gave me a gift bag with water and chocolate covered raisins upon check in. I thought it was a nice touch! :) Room: The room was an okay size...it IS NYC!! :). Plenty of outlets, flat screen TV, comfortable pillows/bed, and was very functional. There is an okay hair dryer in the bathroom. Toiletries included soap, shampoo,conditioner, and lotion. My sister has stayed here in the past and they provided ear plugs due to outside noise. They were not offered to me, but I did not find the outside noise bothersome. That said, the walls of the hotel are somewhat thin and it was easy to hear hallway noise. Amenities: Complimentary breakfast - it was the normal HIEx breakfast spread - a mix of cold cereals, coffee, juice, sausage and gravy, scrambled eggs, cinnamon rolls, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, etc. Wifi - complimentary and the front desk provided a code. There are also a couple of PC work stations in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: PJice9
Reviews.Content: A very nice stay at the HI Express at Madison Square Garden. The hotel is within a five minute walk from NY Penn Station making it perfect if you are arriving from Newark Airport (30 minutes away by train). Very well situated for exploring Manhattan. Clean rooms, nice staff, can't recommend enough.

Reviews.Title: “filthy carpets, dusty rooms, poor ventilation”
Reviews.Author: vermonter1984
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in serious need of total renovation. I is not a pleasant place to stay. Although reservations had been booked in advance and required two beds per room (six women reserved reserved three rooms), we were told that there were no two bed rooms available. A buffet breakfast is available if you can make your way through the throngs of people crowded in to get, what may be , their only meal of the day! There are much nicer accommodations available elsewhere for the same amount of dollars.. On a postive note, we found the staff to be pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great if you need to be at the train station or near the airport”
Reviews.Author: belgoamerican
Reviews.Content: I was surprised here since this was a business trip. The desks were too small to be able to work there. Also, the internet did not function and I had to spend more than a half an hour with the helpdesk myself just to get a connection set up, though I had no specific problems with my laptop. Telephone also needed to be fixed by the handyman as something was wrong in the phone itself. The heaters keep the room warm enough, but lots of noise on start-up and since it was blown from the box, there was a 10 degree difference from the floor to the bed level. But, in any case, Ithe sleep was fine. Breakfast was edible, but the quality of the eggs and sausage was readily noticed as not top! There was sufficient quantity, though, and the pancake maker was efficient enough. One Elevator was out for 2 days, which meant all the clean up and maintenace crews competed with the clients for space on the lifts. There was a safe at the front desk, which I appreciated greatly so I didn't need to carry passports, etc., around all the time in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunray11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good value for what it is - a typical tourist hotel. However it has all the amenities one would need. Its really close to subway and train stations and a stones throw from Madison Square Garden, Macy's and Empire State Building - to mention just a few of the typical tourist destinations. Breakfast is a do-it-yourself buffet in the lobby - nothing special but good enough to start the day with -toast, muffins, pancakes (industrial from a machine), and some hot foods like scrambled eggs, sausages and porridge. There is free coffee / tea all day too in the lobby. I would stay there again if I was sight seeing in NY. If I wanted some luxury I would choose something a bit more pricy.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location...clean... good value”
Reviews.Author: KenOntariocanada
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last night Jan 24/2012. Very clean room a little on the small side. OK sized bathroom. Exactly what we needed a clean place to sleep very good location. We had room 1214 on the front side of the hotel. I was a little loud around 6 AM. A few people playing musical horns. The front desk was more than helpful with direction and good places to eat. It was appx. 5 min walk to MSG. 15 min to Times Square. Never took the bus or subway. The A/C worked fine. Didnt use the heat. The free breakfast was good. Pancakes,sausage i think i saw eggs. Cereal juice etc. Overall very happy with my stay. I would recommened this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: dsr1122
Reviews.Content: Like most hotels in this class in NYC, the rooms are small. However, they are VERY clean, which is nice for hotels in NYC. The hotel itself is pretty nice, though when I stayed one of the 2 elevators was broken, meaning long waits to get up to the room and back down to the lobby. The breakfast area, as other as noted, is a bit small, but I had no problems getting a table early (7 AM). When I checked out around 8 AM, it was pretty full. Breakfast was average, but it's included which is a nice tough. I was surprised how noisy my room was, even though I faced an inner courtyard, the sounds of NYC still invaded the room. Location wise, this is close to Madison Square Garden, but it's a bit of walk to other NYC attractions (though the subway is close by). All in all, not a bad hotel, but not great either.

Reviews.Title: “acceptable location”
Reviews.Author: jRoQuincy
Reviews.Content: We arrived in NYC on the busiest Saturday of the holiday season. The crowds were amazing and the room prices were extremely high. I chose the HIEx because it was close to Penn Station (we flew into Newark) and the morning breakfast. Be advised: do not follow the hotel site directions from Penn Station. There are many one way streets and the directions are clearly for drivers. They need to update the info and give walking directions from Penn Station. It was the most circuitous trip imaginable. We had to leave our bags and check in later in the day. The room was small but fine. We actually slept quite well. There were two problems. All the room doors seemed to have problems. The door did not seem to shut securely, and any door that closed did so with a loud slam. I questioned the room security, but I guess it was OK. The breakfast room was unable to handle the overflow crowd. Both mornings we felt like hawks waiting for a table. The space does not in any way accomodate the number of people that stay at the hotel. The lines for breakfast backed up to the elevator and it was impossible to navagate the hotel lobby. The food was fine, but it was a stressful way to start long sightseeing days. Desj staff was helpful and friendly. I appreciated the "gift" I received as a priority member.

Reviews.Title: “What a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Meeeshia
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel over the 2012 New Year weekend. It's off the beaten path...not far from Penn Station or other NY attractions. Pros: clean and comfortable; great breakfast; pleasant staff...I would definitely stay again at a much lower rate :-). Easy check in/out; Allowed to check out late due to PC membership. Cons: noise level is certainly a problem if other guest are loud. You can hear the doors close - they have the slam factor so, you will hear them closing as often as they are opened. Only one ice machine - lower level behind the breakfast area. Overall a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Proximity”
Reviews.Author: darora123
Reviews.Content: Though an average hotel, but i give more points to it, due to the proximity to Penn Station, Time Square etc. All of which are walking distance. The grand central is also a few blocks away ! Breakfast could have been better ! The staff at the front desk are very friendly and provided adequate support as needed !

Reviews.Title: “Great NYC getaway!”
Reviews.Author: kta2011
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express in Madison Square Garden for 3 nights. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel. It was very clean and they changed our sheets and towels every night. Overall the hotel had a great location, just 2 blocks from Madison Square Garden and 1 block from the nearest subway station. Additionally, the included breakfast saved our group a lot of time in the morning. They had various food options and they swapped them around everyday. Lastly, we were able to check in early (almost 4 hours!) on the first day which again saved us a lot of time of waiting. The hotel also lets you store your bags in their lobby after you check out and before you head over to the airport with absolutely no cost! This is much different from other NYC hotels I have stayed at in the past. Overall I would say for the price of this hotel, it is worth staying here!

Reviews.Title: “A bizarre blend of cleanliness and bad design”
Reviews.Author: Calliope20
Reviews.Content: A blend of cleanliness and neglect, friendly staff and toxic food, fresh new furniture and appalling engineering flaws. I gave it 3 stars mostly for the impressive cleanliness of the room (carpet excepted). Other than he usual ground in dirt and stains in the carpet, the room, bed, and fixtures were immaculate. Bathroom clean and no mold, no peeling paint nor wallpaper, heat and AC worked well. We booked a nonsmoking room, but the minute we walked in the bathroom was full of fresh cigarette smoke as if someone just had one in there. Running the fan dissipated it. Then after a day out, we returned to find the room cleaned and the AC turned on at 60 degrees! It was November at the time, and the room was an icebox. Also, for some bizarre reason, the housekeeper took our hotel provided shampoo away. We had conditioner, soap, lotion, no shampoo, even the tube we had already opened was gone. Weird. Front desk cheerfully gave us more. The odd parts: the curtains don't close. Really. There are very thin see thru sheers, but the heavy curtains are attached to a rod the is fixed in place in the casement. The hooks go in little holes in a plastic strip which is screwed into place on either side of the window, there's not even a short rod to slide them on. They are there to look pretty while the streetlights stream into your window and the people across the street peep at you! We used some binder clips to hold them sort of closed every night. The noise in the hall every night was unbelievable. The door was loosely fit in its frame and both light & noise came thru like the door was paper. The guests had a habit of having private conversations all night in the hallway, and houskeeping felt the need to collect trash bags from a closet every night between midnight & 1am. There's a free hot breakfast in the morning: biscuits, cereal, eggs, sausage, coffee, etc. However a couple hours later both my husband and I had severe indigestion. We've travelled the world and eaten some really strange things (see our Japan reviews), but this "normal" food did us in! You get what you pay for. This is NY, go anywhere else for breakfast! All this together made it completely unenjoyable, even though we barely spent any time in the room. Again, 3 stars, but I would NOT recommend it! As of our stay they had no bedbugs.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located!”
Reviews.Author: Marie2803
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, just before Christmas. First of all, the hotel is perfectly located. You are close to subway station and between major attractions. If you like walking, you can do that easily to see Statue of Liberty, Wall st., UN and Central Park. However, the big problem is the proximity of the rooms. The walls are so thin you can hear your neighbor. And when he closes his door, the lock is so noisy. The first night we didn't sleep very well because the other room went in and out without take care to hold the door. But, the other night, it was perfect. (we had new neighbor ;)) Also, the room is tiny, but for us it was ok in fact we went there just to sleep and didn't have a lot of luggage. The room is clean, the service excellent. When we checked in, we got a room near the elevator. We asked for another one and the man at the front desk was very kind and helpful. The breakfast is nice even if the breakfast room is very small. Parking next to with special rate. A must!

Reviews.Title: “Clean But...”
Reviews.Author: McBerr
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say the hotel was very clean and well kept. In NYC, that is a big plus. Having said that, there are couple of things worth mentioning about. The rooms are tiny, I understand it is NYC and real estate is premium, but the fact of the matter is the rooms are small. If you are planning your visit with family or a group of people, given the circumstance, you may want to consider something a little bigger. The rooms are very close to each other, and the walls are not the best for sound proofing. If you are a light sleeper, consider that. The hotel is very large, but the breakfast area is just an extension of the lobby, therefore you may end up eating in your room, given the lack of seating area. The quality of the breakfast is no frills. A lot of questions were asked in regard to what certain things are?? But having breakfast is better than not, so that's a plus. On the first night, we had to be moved to a different hotel because everything was booked sold out. The second night we had to wait quite a while for the room to be ready. This gives you a taste of the popularity of the place. It is fairly convenient, close to Penn Station, Macy's and other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: jeremiahLiverpoolUK
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights at this hotel from 19th Dec 2011. I arrived at 0900 in the morning and was allowed to check into my room (Thanks Jackie). The reception staff were helpful and friendly. Rooms were clean as were the bedding and towels.Housekeeping good ( thanks Ivette). It is not the Grosvenor House, nor are its prices. A decent hotel, in a great location. I never got up for breakfast as there are plenty of cheap options outside to make sleeping in a pleasure. Free coffee in reception all day and an area to chill out , inside and outside. What's not to like?

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here!”
Reviews.Author: famousuk
Reviews.Content: after a long flight and 2hours in line for security we arrived at this hotel to be informed no rooms. we booked in july 2 rooms with 2 beds. eventually we had 1 double bed and 1room with 2 beds on the lower floor next to house keeping. carpets in corridor and rooms were heavily stained, central heating very noisy so no sleep. we were informed no manger on duty until monday! i have been to nyc 4 times and stayed in 4 different hotels 3 i would return to.... not this one. we were not the only ones that weekend to have difficulties

Reviews.Title: “Awful service!!! Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: Wchoi
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in trip hotel for 4 days with 3 friends for a short trip. The rooms are a bit small and walls were thin so we can hear alot of noise but after reading the reviews, it was expected which was fine. The one thing that was really awful was when we arrived to check in on the first day, the room we had booked with 2 double beds was not available so they split us up into two separate rooms each with a king bed. The next day after having breakfast we wanted to go back into the room to get ready before heading out. Without notification, the hotel had disabled our room key card. Confused, I went to the reception desk to get it reactivated only to be told that we had only booked the hotel for one evening and we had to check out by noon. After asking them to double check because we had paid to stay for 3 nights and we only stayed 1, the reception had a look and told us we only had the room change for one night, and we were told we had to pack and up and moved out of our room to a new one within ONE HOUR. We were furious; when we checked in, the girl who checked us in did not say anything about moving rooms again the next day, it was assumed if they gave us a room we would stay in it for the entire time. We ended up spending 2 hours of our time packing up and moving to another room, it was a extreme hassle and we wasted our entire morning doing something unnecessary. In the evening we discovered the new room's washroom had worm like bugs!!! When we asked to speak to the manager we were told that they were not in and had to wait till he/she was back to speak to him/her. In the end our concerns were not addressed.This was an awful experience. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you don't want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: travelingbunny16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and were extremely disappointed as well as sleep deprived. The walls in this hotel are as thin as a tissue and the sound of slamming doors, people walking on the floor above us and sounds of opening and closing drawers kept us awake all night. We finally turned the TV on around 3AM to try to drown out some of the constant noise. The room was small and clean. The staff was also pleasant. The elevator in the hotel seemed to be built in the year 1905. It moved extremely slow and was extremely small as well. If an elevator is full you'll have a long wait ahead of you until the next elevator comes. Good luck if you are trying to call the front desk. We tried on the way into NYC to see if valet parking was available and no one answered. We also tried to call the front desk from our room. The phone just rang and rang. There was a lot of food available for the free breakfast if you wanted to fight the crowd to get some food. There are very few tables available in the breakfast area so plan on taking your food back up the extremely slow elevator to your room. There was an abundance of non-English speaking people staying at the hotel and they cut in front of lines at the front desk and at the breakfast buffet. We were also pushed by some of these guests as they tried to get into the elevator ahead of us rather than wait their turn. We only stayed here for one night and we could not wait to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, loved the in-room jacuzzi!”
Reviews.Author: MissSKH
Reviews.Content: You know what to expect from Holiday Inn Expresses! The breakfast options are wide and included in the price. The location is excellent - just a couple of blocks from a subway station. The airport bus from JFK runs a route a couple of blocks away so I simply hopped off near the hotel. We got a room with the hot tub / jacuzzi in it. It was fabulous! There was a glass screen seperating the bathroom from the bedroom which you could open and it made the room very open plan. I have stayed in far more expensive hotels in NYC with smaller rooms. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadagain65
Reviews.Content: I can't add a lot more than others have written. Yes, the rooms are a bit small, but who goes to NYC to stay in their room. They are also clean. Nice bathroom, but also small. If you plan on hanging out in the room, stay elsewhere. Plenty of choices for breakfast. And yes, it can get crowded. Go early or later to avoid the business crowds. Staff was very friendly. The hotel is near Penn station, but if you go to 7th ave & 28th street, there is a subway station that is closer than Penn station. If you buy to much in NYC and need to ship stuff home, there is a Post office on 8th ave. We were very close to having to do just that. We just barely fit our purchases in our suitcase and carry-ons. I would definitely stay here again. The hotel was in a great location. Also, we had dinner at Mustang Harry's around the corner on 7th ave. Very good food.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and surprisingly big!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kdoneida
Reviews.Content: We booked this room at the last minute and never stayed here before. When walking into the room we both were shocked with the size and how clean it was! I honestly wouldn't stay anywhere else in NYC after staying here just one time. The outdoor area is perfect for smokers to have a place to sit and enjoy yourself outside!

Reviews.Title: “Good for location”
Reviews.Author: Jessies_Grandad
Reviews.Content: Very functional hotel. Very clean if a bit cramped but considering the location this is to be expected at the price. Just five or ten minutes stroll to Empire State Building, Macey's and Times Square. Free coffee all day and a decent complimentary breakfast. Good budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “just right but thin walls!”
Reviews.Author: pat b
Reviews.Content: great location with clean rooms. fast and crowded buffet breakfast but very thin walls that capture every sneeze! friendly staff and nice walkable location. lots of families with kids the W/E wewere there. Quiet street too in Manhattan. Fitness room is just one bike in a mirrored room, the price is right though,

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location with plenty of services, but uncomfortable beds.”
Reviews.Author: Atltraveler607
Reviews.Content: PCR Member. Stayed here in September 2011 traveling on business. It was $400 plus a night during Fashion Week, booked 20 days out. Hotel had great location, front desk was very friendly and helpful. Provided PCR Bag with Water and Snacks. Internet is included, and was very fast. Rooms are standard size for NY. I had a jetted tub room, which has a rather strange setup with the Tub/shower separating the bedroom area. Bathroom side is a curtain, bedroom side is a sliding door. Although it appears awkward at first, its actually a benefit when getting ready in the morning, you can shave, etc. in the bathroom with a clear view of the TV in the other room when you move the sliding door. Free Breakfast, was hot, and tended often, with a large variety of hot and cold foods. I would give this 4 of 5, except that the beds were very hard. At the end of a long day you want to sleep, and I woke up with kinks, and didn't sleep well in such an uncomfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Hondacrx
Reviews.Content: Great service would deffo stay again it's quite near to main tourist places and subways only thing missing was a bar

Reviews.Title: “Has Everything You Need”
Reviews.Author: PhilsPhan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3-night stay at the Holiday Inn Express Madison Square Garden. Bought it on Hotwire for $174 per night. We arrived by train at Penn Station, and the hotel was a very short walk (2-3 blocks) away, which was very convenient since we brought lots of luggage. The location is excellent (on 29th St between 7th & 8th Aves). We were able to walk just about everywhere (took about 20 minutes to get to Times Square area). The # 1 subway was 1 block away, so we were able to ride that for a trip downtown. Lots of great places to eat within walking distance in Chelsea on 7th and 8th Avenues. We also walked a bit further to check out Eataly one day for lunch (5th Ave & 23rd St). A very nice free breakfast is included, and each day there were some slight variations (pre-made omlettes one day, scrambled eggs the next day, etc.), but get there early for seats or you might be better off taking the food back up to your room to eat. Rooms were small, as many are in Manhattan, but they were clean and modern. Staff was helpful with any requests (e.g., to give us more room, we asked if they could store our baby stroller rather than keep in our room, which they gladly did each day). Would definitely stay here again if the price was reasonable, and also would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and good location”
Reviews.Author: Langemakki
Reviews.Content: Due to hurricane Irene we had a delay of 3 night, the 3 night were rebooked to new dates without any problem! Ms. Jacqueline Felix is a great help by email and phone, also the staff upon arrival was great. The rooms are decent sized and clean, ask for a high floor room as there's some traffic in the streets (or close your windows..). Breakfast is up to US standards, not european so no cheese, ham but hamburgers and pancakes. Good coffee (all day) and free water. Location is close to Madison Square Garden station, nice walk (25 min) to Times Square. The hotel can organise a private cab so easy going to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location to explore this vibrant city”
Reviews.Author: groobster
Reviews.Content: Our first time in NYC saw us stay at the Holiday Inn Madison Square Garden. Located on 29th Street, it is just a five minute walk from Penn Station from where we'd arrived into the City. The rooms, like many in big cities, aren't the largest, but they are well appointed and are clean and tidy. We weren't there for the room, we were there to explore the sights of the Big Apple. The hotel offers a free coffee station on the ground floor, whilst there's a self-service breakfast that comes with the price - a rarity in the US. Everyday we loaded up on juices, coffee, cereals and cakes. The weather was great so on most days we sat outside at the tables and watched the world go to work whilst enjoying breakfast. The hotel is easily within walking distance of Time Square, Empire State Building, Rockefeller and the Flat Iron, the subway is right around the corner for those trips further afield. We enjoyed our stay there, but one word of advice, don't arrange a cab to the airport with the hotel. We were assured that the price included the cost of the toll, the cab driver held a different view, it was a good job we had some spare dollars to pay him. We'll surely visit NYC again, and wouldn't hesitate to stop at the same place.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: Saraw01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my family. The location is fantastic, central for all the famous NY landmarks. Yes the rooms are small but you come to NY to see all it has to offer, not to sit in a hotel room! The staff were friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble. Breakfasts were hectic but ideal for busy tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Express Holiday Inn Madison Square Garden, NYC”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrs52
Reviews.Content: Great location for this hotel, only one block from Madison Square Garden, underneath which is both the Amtrak and subway stations, only 5 mins to walk the street wheeling your luggage, great! The hotel was very clean, the rooms are compact but had everything you need for the short time you spend in them, after all you don't go to NYC to sit in your hotel room. The staff were extremely curteous and helpful and answered all our tourist related questions. We've stayed at the Express HI hotels before so knew the format etc we didn't want to spend a fortune on a plush 5* hotel when we didn't expect to spend a great deal of time in it, the Express HI 'did everything it said on the tin' and was a good choice for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice for a shor stay”
Reviews.Author: Jose P
Reviews.Content: Very well placed (two bloks from Pen Station), 2km Times Square nice place, simple and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Problems 1st night but rectified straightaway”
Reviews.Author: stechap
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in total, one night at the beginning of a tour and 2 days at the end. The first night we were all set for bed after a long flight when we noticed that the sheets hadnt been changed from the previous guest - not a good start! However, we rang down to reception and this was sorted very quickly. Both rooms we stayed in were clean and tidy, a bit small with the 2 beds in but for a city centre hotel you cant expect too much more. The free breakfast was well organised, if a little busy, and there were plenty of options both cold and hot. The hotel is in a great location, 10-15 minutes walk from times square and there is also a subway station at the end of the street for attractions further afield. Would definitely recommend this to anyone visiting New York

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: HofIlkley
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights and it ideally situated within a short walking distance of Times Square, Broadway, Empire State Building and the underground which you can catch to the Ground Zero Memorial Garden. The accommodation was excellent and the free breakfast sets you up for the day. Really good choices of eating houses to suit all pockets within a 5-10minutes walk from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: KenLiverpoolUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night prior to a cruise and it was excellent. Staff very helpful, rooms up to standard and well situated. A free breakfast too! Stayed at a different hotel when we returned for four days and it wasn't a patch on this.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but very drab”
Reviews.Author: yunderup1
Reviews.Content: We were booked on a Fall Foliage tour which started from the hotel and needed to book in a day early. Hotel is in good location, staff helpful, but it was all - well - so brown! Our room was brown everything. We were quoted $408 per night but got it online a bit cheaper. I know prices are high in New York but this is pretty basic. There is no fridge in room, no safe, shabby carpet, the curtains didn't close properly, no globe in the bedside lamp (though fixed promptly when reported). Cardboard cups if you want to make a coffee in the room. No glasses. Breakfast was OK. On the plus side, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was clean. The hotel needs tarting up a bit. It could be really nice. It is overpriced for the quality of the rooms but served its purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Basic functional hotel popular with tourists”
Reviews.Author: Hugh M
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights mid week with a colleague on a trip to attend a conference. This hotel is pretty unremarkable. It looks modern from the outside, but the rooms are a bit dated, and on the small side. Mine was pretty dark and there was definitely no view to speak of. Reception was pretty efficient, although I was glad we arrived before the coach load of tourists who were then queuing behind us at check in. WiFi was free although the password they give you at checking changes each day which means you need to call reception, which is a pain. It was fast once I got it going, but the sign-in screen where you put the username and password were very difficult to use on my iPad and iPhone and froze a few times. Breakfast is basic self service but absolutely fine, although it was extremely busy. Think cinnamon rolls, preprepared omelets, plastic cutlery.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Meghan B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just what we needed/wanted for our short, one-night stay. We drove through the night and arrived in NYC at 8:00 am when check-in wasn't until 4:00 pm. The staff let us check in and even allowed us to take advantage of the free breakfast! The breakfast was tasty, especially the warm cinnamon rolls. The room was small (but no smaller than other hotel rooms in New York I imagine). The linens were clean as was the bathroom. There are computers with printers in the main lobby. The hotel gladly held our bags while we toured the city the following day which was convenient. We parked in the garage right next door. They give a discount to hotel guests as long as you bring a receipt. We paid $25 a day, better than the hotel valet rate for sure! Also, the Italian Deli on the corner has the most delicious chicken parmigiano sandwich!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Mid-Town”
Reviews.Author: pwelch
Reviews.Content: Found a reasonable rate and stayed here for a few nights on my second trip to new York city! I took a shared shuttle from JFK which dropped me at Penn station, right around the corner. It's location was also great to get the Megabus to Philly. Check in was smooth, the room was small, although this I expected. Breakfast was chaotic, a good selection and plenty of food which w constantly replenished. The problem was the size of the area is way too small for the size of the hotel. I therefore took mine back to the room. Free wifi and computer terminals in reception. I used these to book a concert ticket for Lady Gaga at Madison Square Garden, right around the corner!

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for!!”
Reviews.Author: Stuart P
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, and in a good location for Penn Station and a short walk to shops. Budget Hotel in quiet back street. You only get what you pay for. Breakfast buffet was included in overall cost, most people had coffee, toast, eggs and burgers, fresh fruits and yogurts all available. Room small but adequate for two people although limited storage space, we didn't unpack as only staying for two nights. Check in/out was quick and easy with facilities to keep luggage if not leaving till later.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: traveltrio03
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate considering prices in New York. 2 blocks from Madison Square Garden, and train station. Biggest drawback was size of rooms . There were three of us in the room and we could barely move and very little storage space. Good thing we spent most of our time out of the room, except to sleep. Good value in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe, worst hotel stay ever.”
Reviews.Author: IrishAoife
Reviews.Content: I requested a quite room for my family in checking in. My parents were put next to a room of 8 guys (in single room) who partied non-stop for 3 days (until on average 7am). There are also a number of prostitutes working out of the hotel, so they were awake all night as multiple men knocked/pounded on the doors down the hall, shouted out passwords, this woman's name etc. Key card access isn't required for the elevators so anyone can walk in off the street (and they do). My parents didn't feel safe at all. We've stayed at holiday inns in the past and they are usually OK. This place really needs to make the elevator key card access only and get better security.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Pascal G
Reviews.Content: Ive been there twice, stayed for a few days and there are pros and cons. Pros: Location, great central location in manhattan! 1 block to fashion avenue (7th ave) and walking distance to subway line, Madison Square Garden and even Time Square. The hotel is clean, staff are friendly and continental breakfast is great compared to other chain hotels. Cons:The rooms and the hotel in general are very small. What you can expect from Manhattan. Plus, its very expensive. For that price you would expect much more. But again, all of nyc is pretty expensive. All and all it did the job, great location, clean and I would still go back there, especially if I had a good price or a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, bare bones”
Reviews.Author: larn796
Reviews.Content: Very close to subway and Penn Station. Very convenient to shopping and inexpensive eateries. Walking distance to Broadway theaters. The room itself was tiny but ok as an overnight for one person. There were stains on the wall and the dresser drawers were not aligned on there tracks, which I fixed. Otherwise the room was moderately clean. I would probably stay here again if I were to get the same discounted rate. There is a nice area outside with tables. Breakfast is provided.

Reviews.Title: “It works”
Reviews.Author: joshuaelee
Reviews.Content: Checked in for four days last week. Was in town for business. Its located a couple blocks away from Madison Square Garden. Hotel is ok and decent location. Room was small but quiet. Not a lot of noise from the street. No microwave or fridge. All in all, just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Giraffe26
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location 2 street corners from Penn Station. We came to NYC by train and had tickets to the US Open so the location was perfect!! The hotel itself is nothing special. It is a bland, but clean place. We got a wheelchair accessible room which means that it was a bit larger than the standard. The free Wifi in the room was great. There is also breakfast included in the price of the room, but 1) it is chaos (too many people, too few places to sit) and 2) the food was not very good. There are so many affordable places to eat breakfast/brunch in NYC that we did this instead. I would probably try another hotel when I go back to NYC next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Sarita53
Reviews.Content: Express must mean bare bones. No safe in the room, no cups in the bathroom, just a generic bar of soap and generic shampoo. The room was reasonably sized but the carpet and walls were stained. The bathroom had a bad odor because the weak ceiling fan did not ventilate the moisture out of the room. There was no security at all - no one manning the front door, no restrictions on entering the elevator or the floors. The floor in the elevator was filthy as were the rugs in the hallway. That said, I was happy they had a room available on a moment's notice when we fled a bedbug infested hotel. On the plus side, the bed was comfortable, the maid was helpful, and Tenille at the front desk was very attentive. We only stayed a night and then moved on to a nearby far superior hotel at a lower rate (Hilton Fashion District). This is basically a Manhattan Motel 6, not worth the $300 deal price we paid for the night, and certainly not worth the full price of $550 since it has no amenities at all.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Smelly”
Reviews.Author: Anne C
Reviews.Content: I was really happy with the location of the hotel when we arrived - right in the middle of midtown and near a lot of the major attractions. Then we got to our room! This hotel smells old and musty - the air con smells like damp and is really noisy. The walls in the room need repair/redecoration and are paper thin - you can hear whatever is going on around you. We asked for a wheelchair accessible room. The bathroom is accessible, with a walk-in shower - but nowhere to transfer to, unless you count the floor. The room is very dark with one small window at the back so we have to have all the lights on even in the morning. The good points: comfortable bed, TV that works, iron and ironing board in room, lots of plug sockets. However, for an accessible room, the light switches are too far away from the bed, and the bed is really quite high - having to transfer up to it. The housekeeping service leaves something to be desired - we got clean towels and they remade the bed. They didn't clean the coffee pot or anything else. Breakfast is fair - a bit of a free for all - with the standard offerings. I guess you could say, "you get what you pay for" but this hotel was not at all cheap!! The staff are very friendly and helpful, and always very busy. A few things to note: if you are staying in midtown NY, expect to lose your mobile signal frequently, apparently everybody knows this (we didn't). In this particular hotel, the guest wifi password changes every few days (they didn't tell us this, we found out). If all you want to do is have a place to rest your head for a few hours at night, this hotel is ok. This hotel does not offer the same Holiday In Express standard we have experienced in the UK and Europe, which has always been much much better. What a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For Family Visit”
Reviews.Author: DONBSAD
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here with two kids and the location worked very well. Space is tight in New York City and for the money this is about as good a deal as you will likely get for a room with two full beds (we paid about 280 per night with all the taxes included). There is a parking garage right next door for $25 per day. The hotel was one block away from subway, which we used to go to Battery park for Statue of Liberty Cruise and ground zero. I would not try to drive and park in the city. The hotel was also close to Time Square, Empire State building, and Rockefeller Center. We loved the Statue of Liberty tour with access into the statue foundation and we loved the Top of the Rock from Rockefeller at night. We also used a pedicab in central park and thought it was well worth the $100 after walking around all day.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Reassuring Staff and Service during Hurricane Irene”
Reviews.Author: citygal234
Reviews.Content: Just a short trip to New York ended up being a small adventure due to hurricane Irene, however the staff at HEI Madison Square were second to none in making everybody feel safe and comfortable for the duration of the hurricane. Aside from the 'adventure' the hotel itself was great, evrything you can imagine in New York, smart, spotlessly clean and amazingly helpfull and friendly staff. The food, well what can I say, fabulous, huge, very very good indeed almost to the point of not being able to stop eating - need to throw away the scales now! Thanks to everyone at the hotel for everything.

Reviews.Title: “The service level at this Holiday Inn is excellent”
Reviews.Author: JimWCPA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Holiday Inn through the Hurricane Irene weekend. We were in Manhattan for a long weekend and booked a standard room (2 double beds) for 3 nights. While the room was smaller than we are accustomed to, it is normal by NYC standards. Where HIE distinguished itself is with the level of service during the Hurricane. Management communicted very early on with a printed note in each room regarding their preparations. That simple communication to customers is so often overlooked. Management was on property the entire weekend, brought in extra food, made sure we understood that a generator was available in the event of electrical interruption, etc. The staff were all very friendly and most helpful throuhgout our stay. I can highly recommend this hotel. Also, the location is really good, only 1 block from the 28th Street MTA station for lines 1, 2, and 3. Walkable to Times Square in decent weather.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Realer
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn is the perfect location for anyone visiting NY for the first time like we were,its also very clean and staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Anntastik
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value for the location. Rooms were small but they had everything you needed and free wi-fi!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Betty_Booper
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Holiday Day Inn Express @ Madison Square on a recent stay in NYC. This was a 20th anniversary trip. We were very pleased with this hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room size was fine for two people and about what I expected for a hotel room in NYC. I checked the room over and was very happy to find NO BED BUGS!!! This had been a concern after reading about all the bed bug issues in New York City. The room was clean and we had enough towels, etc during out stay.The breakfast was a nice surprise. There was a good variety of food and the staff was helpful. It was crowded when we were there & had to wait for a table. This hotel was within an easy walking distance of most of the "sights" we wanted to see. The hotel was also helpful in holding our luggage a few extra hours after we checked out, as our flight did not leave until 8PM that night, Overall I rate this property excellent and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good base to explore Manhattan Island”
Reviews.Author: Vicky6274
Reviews.Content: I went to NYC for 4 nights in May to celebrate the 40th birthdays of two of our party. The hotel rooms were cosy! Well equipped but with two double beds in each there was not much room for anything else. Originally were were going to have three of us in one room, but someone dropped out, and thank goodness they did! There is no way we would have got three women in the room along with our luggage. Getting ready to go out would have been a total and utter nightmare! That being said the room was very clean, there was always loads of hot water at any time of the day or night, powerful shower and good hair dryer in the room. We did have a few little niggles we first arrived with the room and the reception staff got it sorted straight away. The guys at reception were excellent, well informed and couldn't do enough for us. The best thing about this hotel is that it has a free buffet breakfast for all of the people staying in the hotel and unlimited coffee in reception day and night, none of this is advertised but it was fabulous. It ment we didn't have to go out in to NYC to find breakfast as well as our lunch and dinner as well. I would stay here again but this time wouldn't expect a big american hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Worn out - major need of renovation - book onlyif it's really cheap”
Reviews.Author: out8974
Reviews.Content: Really needs a facelift. Anyone can just walk in and get on the elevator. Lots of LOUD guests

Reviews.Title: “We had a great weekend!!”
Reviews.Author: Blessed1711
Reviews.Content: We just spent three great days in NYC and I am so glad that we picked the Holiday Inn Express Madison Square Garden. The location was perfect. We walked to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Central Park and the Winter Garden theatre to see Mama Mia . The staff was very friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my family and friends. I am sure I will be back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “First time to NYC and couldn't ask for more!!”
Reviews.Author: arsenand
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awesome! Wonderful breakfast included in the price. Excellent location, an easy walk (2 blocks) from Penn Station and good walk to Times Square. Clean rooms and decent size for NYC. Do not hesitate to book this hotel!! It's the best!

Reviews.Title: “it was okay but no we would not stay here again..”
Reviews.Author: sheri19
Reviews.Content: While the staff was very nice.. The breakfast menu for the whole week was exactly the same each day.. How much scrambled eggs and sausage patties can one eat?? We ended up eating elsewhere some mornings and yes it was very busy in the morning. We were always scrambling to get a table... Definately needed to change things up for breakfast. The street itself where the hotel is located in kind of run down and scary at night... We did ask for the bedding to be changed and we noticed that it was not changed and there was hair in it ..eww..... We paid a fair amount for this hotel and while it was okay.. no we would not stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here & would so go back!!”
Reviews.Author: janetjuly2011
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to NY and we got to go to our room early, all of the staff were very accomodating & friendly. The girls at the continental breakfast were so friendly. The rooms were small-as we expected for NY-but were very clean. We loved it and would so recommend it to friends and will be staying here again on our next trip to NY!!

Reviews.Title: “We got more attention from the hooker outside our room than the front desk.”
Reviews.Author: SLTraveling
Reviews.Content: Seriously, we pick Holiday Inn and the Intercontinental brand for quality and reliability. Sure, in New York City you are going to expect some diversity and crowds; however, nothing could have prepared us for the experience at this hotel. First, there were several "interesting" guests (which we later learned were hookers who ran their business out of their rooms). Second, not one but two large school groups (of teenage girls). This meant loud running in the hallways and hallway congregating until all hours. Then, the first and second categories mixed together leading to loud shouting and much drama (which woke us up two evenings in a row). The first comment relating to the hooker created a problem repeatedly during or staff from the very loud woman (and her roommate) as well as the men who visited her. The front desk NEVER answered their phone. We had to walk to the front desk to ask them to quiet down the hallway (no security to intervene). The second night the phone was broken. Cleanliness was very good and the room was attractive (this is what we expect from IHG and a Holiday Inn). Would not recommend this hotel. They are under staffed and could not promise a good night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: cmarmot
Reviews.Content: I found in "hotwire" a really good deal, I spent as much as in another small town of the united states, but instead I was in New York, two block away from Penn Station , so it easy if you travel by train and plane, it is one block from subway line. It is a walking distance from Macy's.They offer breackfast ( as usually on Holiday Inn Express), the breakfast room is not very big, in consideration of the fact that the hotel was crowed, but during summer time they have some tables outside. My room was close to the elevator, but was not noisy at all. I didn't feel the room as small, I thought was in the European standard.

Reviews.Title: “A slew of disappointment”
Reviews.Author: lenusvyat
Reviews.Content: 1. Worst of all, somehow as a gold member I got shifted to the room on the first floor – CLOSEST to the hotel entry way and closest to the lobby and elevators. Clearly, I have gotten very little sleep since I heard everything that was happening in the lobby and the elevators 2. Although the coffee machine was promised on the booking, there was no coffee machine in the room; I asked for it, waited 30 minutes and fell asleep (it was 10:30pm). At 10:45, someone finally showed up 3. Closet hangers were broken 4. Cover from the AC broke off when I picked it up 5. One of the two telephones in the room were broken

Reviews.Title: “Great position at a good price”
Reviews.Author: ValeriaPL
Reviews.Content: we stayed here on Christmas. the position is great because it's 2 minutes walking from the metro station and 5 minutes from Madison square, Macy, 15 minutes from Times Square. The price is absolutley right for NYC, maybe low. they also offer the breakfast, it's not excellent but not so bad and it's included in the room price. I think I could consider this hotel again for my next trip to NYC

Reviews.Title: “Handy and Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Southlandrover
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel prior to commencing a packaged 23 day bus tour across the United States. It was one of the few hotels who included a comprehensive daily breakfast and although it has a "boutique" style breakfast area which was extremely busy and quite crowded we were able to utilise the outside tables as well which set us in the mood for sighseeing in the Big Apple. Our room was more than adequate and comfortable. I would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay Location is Perfect”
Reviews.Author: KPALO2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May for 5 days and have previously stayed here before we love the location, breakfast in the morning is a plus to start your day off and saves you money on that. Staff is very friendly always ready to assist you, very clean the deli around the corner on 8th is wonderful, good restaraunts close by you cant go wrong here, will defenitly come back

Reviews.Title: “Great for first time to NYC”
Reviews.Author: DL2DB
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for what we needed it for. It was centrally located to what we wanted to do: sightsee. We got a decent deal {as decent as NYC hotels go}, and it was great for what we paid. The room was small, and we had no view, but we expected that. It is on a street with little else, however the italian restaurant a few doors down was very good. The front desk staff was polite and very helpful. The breakfast buffet was great each morning, and really helped keep costs down on eating out. There was always plenty of food, and places to sit. The elevators were having some problems while we were there, but at least 1 always worked. We stayed in a room a few doors down from the elevators, so we heard some noise from guests in the hall, but not bad. Our room had a neat feature that allowed acess to the tub from both the bathroom and the bedroom area. WHile this was fun, it did not allow much privacy for anyone needing to use the bathroom facilities. Overall, if I had to, I would stay here again, especially for the price. There are just so many hotels in NYC that I would go somewhere else to see different neighborhoods. This worked great for us, as Penn Station was just a few blocks north, so we were able to haul our luggage with us to get a train to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location for Sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Sadlerkelly
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my 18 year old daughter and was delighted with the location of this hotel. Clean rooms with helpful staff and provided a good breakfast to start the day. Would definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fabulous staff and good value for the money in midtown Manhattan.”
Reviews.Author: jaybar1
Reviews.Content: |Second time in two years stayed here and very good value. Great location, fabulous staff. Highly recommended, the continental breakfast is also very good way to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay but.....”
Reviews.Author: McT853
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights in June and we picked it for the location, which was brilliant, a few blocks away from Times Square, Empire State Building, Macy's also more importantly near many Subway Stations and also Penn Station. The room was an average size and was very comfortable. The service from the staff and the free internet in the lobby was very helpful. A couple of points let it down though. One was breakfast time. This was way too busy and the room that they hold it was too small for the amount of guests in the hotel. Although the breakfast was OK you had to toast your own items bread, bagels etc which held up everyone especially when it was busy. Also the walls were so thin you could hear everything from the lobby and we were woken a few times over our stay by slamming doors every time someone entered or left a room and people talking. Overall it is a good hotel if you just want the basics and are staying for a short time.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: JayneAustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights before joining a tour. Hotel was in a great location, easy walk to Times Square, subway and 5th Avenue. On a pretty quiet street. The room was good size for New York standard, Bathroom was big enough and was clean. Breakfast was good, cereal, pastries, pancakes, juice, toast, coffee & tea. Although the breakfast room was very small & often very crowded. Front desk were helpful and gave out maps of the area. Free internet was an added bonus. Overall enjoyed our stay and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: bridgiebaby
Reviews.Content: We booked last-minute through Hotwire.com which is a bit of a gamble as hotels are only revealed AFTER you've paid. However we were fairly impressed by several things: - convenient location in Manhattan - close to Macy's and a subway station - breakfast was included - a first in any NYC hotel I saw advertised! A small buffet selection but very fresh and nice - pancakes, toast, sausage, eggs, fruit, cereals, juice and coffee - free internet access in the lobby - although they don't provide chairs so you have to stand - I guess to prevent loiterers - clean rooms and staff were helpful Downside: - some rooms are directly opposite the lifts on each floor and some are just off the reception area - make sure you request not to get one of these! We unfortunately did and were woken by other guests talking very loudly. - the actual entrance was not as glamorous as the website showed and the street they're on is a bit dreary. - cupboard was TINY, rooms small and carpet was very ugly but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Happy to stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Rob&Caralyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights recently and found it a great base to see Manhattan again. 3 blocks from Penn Station making it easy to drop off luggage (used Airtrain & LIRR from JFK) and to drop off shopping done in Midtown area. A real bonus not having to carry it with you. Penn has eateries and shops too. We walked alot from hotel base and found it to be in a safe neighbourhood. Subway station with 6 lines at Penn station. You van literally access EVERYWHERE. Subway so cheap and easy too. Free (good quality!) wi-fi was a real bonus and was excellent. Breakfast was ok, adequate - it was free so thats a big plus. We stayed at peak times so there were a lot of groups and yes, it did get VERY busy and crowded but you know, just wait 5 mins & it's all change. Weather was fabulous so we sat outside. Expect it to be busy and you won't be shocked. We got a seat every morning at different times. Room was clean and average size. really NOT small in UK terms or some other US hotels. We are both very tall and had 3 suitcases (to bring back shopping) and had NO problems.. The bed was extremely comfy. Yes, it can be a little noisy but the hotel was full when we staued. We were right next to an elevator but it was not an issue and yes, the walls are fairly thin. Not once was our sleep was interrupted by people coming and going. Needed air con on as it was 85f so was a bit noisy but it worked well. We stayed in rm 810 and could see the Empire State Building. All staff were very friendly and helpful. A real plus, they helped to make our stay a good one. In summary, we were extremely happy with hotel, location, price (you do have to book early though as 6wks after I booked the prices quoted were $600 more) and staff. We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Internet”
Reviews.Author: wendyt08
Reviews.Content: Literally the slowest internet I've experienced in years. I felt as if I was using dial up when I tried to use my laptop in my room. It wouldn't connect all day and when it finally did not a single page would open. Everything else was okay, but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Bad start, ok finish”
Reviews.Author: SydTraveller09
Reviews.Content: I have never written a bad review on tripadvisor but feel I have to write this. Stayed here from 18 May - 27 May. My first night was terrible, arrived around 10pm and was put in room 105 which is below street level (I had asked for a room on a higher floor), it doesn't have adequate curtains and generally felt very unsafe (I was travelling alone). My phone wasn't working so couldn't make calls, there were no pillows nor coffee maker. I asked for extra blankets and the housekeeper gave me one, when I asked for more than one (it was very cold) he shook his head and walked away (he was holding two others). The door also was not closing properly. The next day around 3pm when I came back to the hotel the housekeeper had left my door open. I was moved to a room on level 5 - which was fine. If you stay here have it confirmed that you will have a room on level 2 or above. The shame is that the hotel has a lot of good points - free internet in the lobby, good breakfast, good location and lovely front desk staff. Another thing is that there are alot of tour groups with older people that stay here, so there were times when I felt like I was vacationing at a retirement village - which isn't much fun when you are in you twenties.

Reviews.Title: “Okay place”
Reviews.Author: Lancashire-Tourist
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on this hotel as Priority Club members, which offered good value for money. However, if I had paid full price for this hotel I would have been disappointed. The room was very small, but having not stayed in other NYC hotels I cannot compare. The room itself was a little tired, but clean and the bed was very comfortable. We stayed for a week, which felt too long for the size of the room - the wardrobe is not really big enough for 2 staying a full week. I asked for additional coat hangers which the housekeeper brought very quickly. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfasts were pretty low grade, but ok. Perhaps what's to be expected for this type of chain hotel. Having coffee available all day was a real bonus. The hotel is not in the very best location in NYC, but plenty of places can be reached fairly easily on foot (e.g. Times Square, Empire State) and Penn Station is just around the corner for other attractions. We walked as far as Central Park. There were plenty of places to eat close by the hotel, but we only liked one of them (Restivo's on 7th Ave near 23rd/24th). A couple nights there was a lot of noise from late night revellers returning which was a bit annoying, but I never felt unsafe or insecure. The hotel offered reasonable value for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely safe hotel for our mum and daughter trip”
Reviews.Author: haziec
Reviews.Content: Our daughter and I stayed at this hotel for four nights when we visited NYC. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast which filled us up for hours and liked the way that tea/coffee was available all day. The location was very good for us, short walk to Empire State and lots of nice places to eat nearby. The subway was very near. The staff were very friendly, room was clean and we had free internet access and local calls in our room which was very useful.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: PaulRuk
Reviews.Content: If i was visiting New York again I would not choose this hotel. The hotel is in a poor area with few quality places to eat at night. The only good restaurant we found was Restivo's which is south down 7th Avenue. The hotel breakfast was OK but only OK and has free coffee served all day which is a nice touch. Service was good as was the cleanliness of the hotel. The hotel is handy for Penn station and not too far from the Empire State Building but that's about it for the location. The usual Holiday inn mattress covers made from plastic ruin an otherwise comfortable bed, rooms at the back of the hotel very noisy due to air con units, rooms are very small with a useless wardrobe but does have a nice bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel location perfect”
Reviews.Author: shazlm
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn Express for 4 days at the beginning of January. It is the perfect location for getting anywhere in New York, Not far from the Subway, the bus terminal, a couple of blocks from Macy's and all the shops. Loads of places to eat near by as well. staff at the desk are really helpful and nothing is too much bother. Rooms are quiet small as there were 4 of us in one room, but all we did was sleep there as out shopping and sight seeing the rest of the time. If you get a chance go shopping at Woddbury Common it was well worth the long bus trip.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience with value”
Reviews.Author: baseballlady
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance to Madison Square Garden and Penn Station, both qualities we desired when we traveled to see the NIT basketball tournament. A great price for the heart of the city. The breakfast room was crowded, but the food was good. The coffee bar was available at all hours of the day and night, which we really appreciated. Only drawbacks--not many restaurants nearby and the street itself was dark and spooky after the dinner hour. (We didn't have any problems, however.) We had heard about a big bed bug problem, but we didn't enounter it here. The staff was efficient and courteous, but were overworked. (There was a big high school choir staying at the same time we were there. They weren't noisy. There were just a lot of them.)

Reviews.Title: “Small compact but clean”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTravelerV
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a night in Manhattan in the summer, prices were sky high for the weekend. We got a great deal at this property. The rooms are really tiny, barely can fit 2 twin beds in a room and not much space left to navigate around. Breakfast is nice, property is near Madison sq garden ... very convineant & certainly comfortale. They let us use the office to print our boarding passes and also held our luggage since we had come in at 9 AM into the hotel. All in all a decent experience

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable for the cost”
Reviews.Author: julesavenue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn for 3 nights but could only get the 2 rooms we requested for 2 nights. On arrival (after check in time) we were told we could only have 1 room with 2 double beds and the other would be kingsize for 1 night with the option to move on the next 2 nights. The room types requested by us with the booking agent apparently are not guaranteed with Holiday Inn. We could only get 1 room on arrival as they had late checkouts and we were told to return after 6pm and it would probably be ready? The rooms are fine we only slept and were out all day. Breakfast was good although as mentioned by other reviewers very busy and the room too small for the hotel(some people ate outside as it was warm) The staff were helpful with booking transport and the hotel is in a convenient area as we didnt mind walking to soak up the atmosphere.
