The hotel has 2 lifts but for the 4 days we stayed only 1 ever worked and this meant guests gave up waiting and bounced cases down a concrete staircase!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Plaza but for Holiday Inn Express pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: xcvbnxkdj
Reviews.Content: Ok so it's not the Plaza and you should not expect too much, but it was reasonably priced, fantastic loacation and included complimentary breakfast which was not exactly classy but included pastries. Eggs, Sausages, Muffins, Bagles, Fruit, Yogurts, Cereal, T&C and Selection of Juices - not bad at all. This hotel was modern and clean, the staff were friendly and it was 2 mins from New York Penn Station which you can get to directly from Newark Airport - really simple journey. It is about 15 mins walk from Times Square and even less to Macey's! For what we paid we could not fault it - and lets face it, if you go to New York your hotel is only a place to sleep - We reccommend it and would stay again if we went back

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, clean and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: donnagilse
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, cleanliness was spot on. Room was just right for two of us and bed was really comfortable. Free breakfast in the morning as much as you want. Can get busy but does not take long to get a table. Staff are really friendly, especially Gloria and Maria on reception who made our stay really good. Will go out of their way to make you feel welcome. Hotel situated on 7th and 29th street, a good position. Just round the corner from the Empire State building and Macys. A short walk to Penn station and not much further to walk to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Good value & great location”
Reviews.Author: albert094
Reviews.Content: The room is a bit small for a family of four adults but very functional with comfortable beds. Love the bathroom, it's very clean and has a bathtub. Big plus is the free buffet breakfast. It's more than enough to fill you up before venturing out in the morning. Hot drinks are always there waiting for you anytime of day/night. Just help yourself and enjoy. The place is family friendly and not intimidating like other posh hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, 'Secret' Patio”
Reviews.Author: Gibarca
Reviews.Content: A lot of what is said here, good and bad, is true. It is in Chelsea, which is not the Village or midtown, true. The rooms are small, very small, but it is Manhattan. The doors do slam and the walls are a little thin. Breakfast is decent, and while busy, we were always able to find a table for two - probably easier when the front patio is open. Staff is pleasant and helpful. The real upsides are that (a) Penn Station is three streets away and (b) the A,C,E; 1,2,3; and N,Q,R subway lines are all within a few blocks. It's not a quiet stay, but what did you expect on the island of Manhattan? Something I did not see mentioned, and it's a shame, is the back patio. Access via the "C" level, it's a nice, tucked away secret for those who find it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: rjdon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great hub for exploring all Manhattan has to offer. Situated within a 5minute walk from 34th Penn station, it allows access via the subway to the whole of NYC. The rooms although basic, are very clean, but could do with a bit more soundproofing (especially for the weekend nights!) The rooms are quite small...but it is New York! Breakfast was included, however ensure you are down early as seating is pretty limited.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT - LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: James-Fairley
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent very clean and tidy, close to the main subway line where it is just one stop from times square and the hotel is within walking distance from the empire state building and herald square where macy's is situated, breakfast is included and really sets you up for the day and thbe staff are so helpful and friendly, free wi-fi makes traveling really easy and with access to a printer this hotel is really outstanding!, i would also reccommend the "new york subway map" application for ipod touch and iphone available on the app store and its FREE it allows you to enter where you are and where you want to go and it tells you what line and what direction plus how many stops it is and how long it will take and also take advantage of the 7 day metrocard for $29 per adult, the hotel also offers unlimited coffee and tea 24/7 perfect after a long day and breakfast can alo be taken to your room also takeaway menus are available at the front desk! i will be going back next year and i hope yoy found this review helpful, CHOOSE THIS HOTEL! ITS AMAZING! and its so close to Penn station and Madison square gardens so from JFK just take the airtrain to jamacia and change to the LIRR to penn station!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for what you need a hotel to be”
Reviews.Author: Agent4699
Reviews.Content: On a last minute whim, we decided to use a hotel after a concert at MSG so I could get some sleep before running a half marathon in the park the next morning. The hotel was cheap (got a good expedia rate), clean (no bed bugs) and a good location (easy walk to 7th or 6th, as well as subways that take you uptown or downtown). It's barebones, small rooms, decent bathroom (ours was not as small as other reviewers described), but if it's a Holiday Inn Express, what do you expect? You don't come to NYC to sit in a hotel, you come to have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: CentralisedControl Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Located on 29th Street, just a couple of blocks from New York Penn (Pennsylvania) station, The railway station in New York for long distance trains operated by Amtrak and the main terminus for New Jersey Transit (for Newark Airport) and Long Island Rail Road (for JFK airport) this hotel gives a good quality & great value in an excellent lacation in New York. Free internet in the rooms and continuously available complementry coffie in the hotel reception are nice features.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: nursewebb
Reviews.Content: Almost cant fault this hotel. Great breakfast, wifi and location. SUPERB housekeeping and breakfast staff!!!! Only issues that come to mind were strangers knocking on our door late (after 10pm) at night, a man one night and a woman another. Neither were answered. On our second to last day a man whom had obviously been issued the wrong details tried to enter our room also with a key card. Other than that I would most definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “NICE STAY IN THE CITY CENTER”
Reviews.Author: tragio
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, not something fancy and extraordinary. Very clean, a liitle bit outdated decoration in the rooms, regular spaces. Very healthy breakfast (not very common for European traveler). It's big advantage is that it is just a few minutes (around 15-20) on foot from time square and less than 10 minutes from empire state building and 5th Avenue. Its very expensive like all New York city hotels, paid more than 200 USD per night.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with appeal of location and cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: frompaPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: Visited NYC with my husband, to attend a tennis event at the Garden. A bit concerned about an overnight visit to NYC, because of the bed bug issue within the city. Absolutely NO SIGNS of any issues with bedbugs in this hotel. The room was extremely clean and the mattress looked brand new. When I am traveling to NYC, I do not expect a large hotel room; therefore, the size of the room was not a challenge for our stay. I will advise that if you are traveling with more than two persons or for an extended stay, know that the room has an area to walk around the bed but is very small. The hotel has a location that is WONDERFUL, within walking distance of Pennsylvania Station, Madison Square Garden, Macys, Empire State Building, just to name a few. Within one block a wide selection of bars and restaurants. And you can't beat the price. The room came with a continental breakfast, which is a cost savings. However, it is within walking distance of Starbucks and a great bagel place, so we didn't take advantage of the breakfast at the hotel. The bed was comfortable, the noise level was at a level to be expected in an inner city hotel. I felt very secure walking to and from the hotel at night. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone who is doing business in the city or would like to get caught between the moon and NYC with someone special.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean hotel, helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: wpg2010
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a 5 night stay at this hotel and it was way more than I had expected for a NYC hotel. The room was a good size for two people, with a king bed. The breakfast in the morning had many options and was always replenished. The rooms and hotel was very clean. The location is a 3 minute walk to MSG and a 10 minute walk from Times Square. One downside is that there are not many places to eat near by. I would stay here again if I return to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value, location, breakfast, and service. GREAT FIND!”
Reviews.Author: Fourseasondreamer
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a quick overnight stay in Manhattan. We booked our room through the Holiday Inn Express website after finding it on Priceline. We originally booked a king room to save money but was "bumped" at our request to a double for the same price. Our total price was $120.00!! The hotel is literally a block and a half away from Penn station making getting around the city super easy. It is a 45 minute train ride from JFK which is not only the fastest way in to the city but the cheapest. Our room was small but perfectly suitable for our needs. The beds were compfy. Our room overlooked the street and had a window that opens, which I prefer. The bathroom was clean and extra towels were delivered upon request. The breakfast was WAY better than expected. Fully stocked with juices, eggs, sausage, biscuits and gravy, cinnamon rolls, bagels, breakfast cereals, etc. The fact that it is included in the price is amazing. The breakfast would have easily cost $10.00-$15.00 in a restaurant. Service was pleasant and efficient. Also, double and triple checked for bed critters and found none. The hotel seemed quite on top of any problem, perceived or factual. We were two sisters traveling alone and felt absoulutely safe. We will stay here again. As a tip if you can stomach fur coats (we can) there are several wholesale furriers on the street that will allow you to walk in and look at the MAGNIFICENT articles for sale. Very neat. If you enjoy history we also recommend "Fraunces Tavern" by WTC and Wall Street. George Washington gave his farewell speech to the Revolutionary war generals at this tavern. VERY COOL HISTORY!! St. Pauls church also has his original pew, the actual one that his deriere sat in!! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Great location”
Reviews.Author: Chris9831
Reviews.Content: Comfortable and clean rooms, rooms were cleaned every day with a change of clean towels. We had a double king room with a jacuzzi bath which was ideal for us, they were a little small, but it's all you need after a long day of sight seeing & shopping! Comfy bed and a lovely jacuzzi. It has a free Internet service in the lobby and if you have your own laptop/iPad you can also use this free service in your room. It has a basic breakfast bar which is a little too small and did get over crowded in the mornings, it has all the regular breakfast necessities which is substantial for the start of a long day! There is coffee and tea provided 24 hours a day in the lobby which is very much appreciated on your return from a long day. The hotel is in an excellent location situated right next to Madison square gardens, Empire state building and 5 minute walk from Time square. The hotel staff were very professional and helpful in every way. We would go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected bargain in great location”
Reviews.Author: spacemanspiff007
Reviews.Content: Booked this blindly via Hotwire or else I wouldn't have come across this place. Decent price of $137 plus taxes per night which is pretty good considering this place is virtually brand new. Room was very small and tight, with the smallest bathroom I've ever seen in a modern hotel, but I glady trade that off for the great location - you don't come to New York to stay in your room right? Madison Square Garden, with all its subway connections, is a couple blocks away as are many casual dining options. Arrived a few hours earlier than expected and this was before check-out time, so I was expecting to have to leave my bags at the front and come back at check-in time. However, they found a room that had been cleaned already and let me settle in right away. Service was very friendly and helpful. Had read some reviews of this hotel that there was a bedbug problem from a handful of people who had stayed there, and was a bit worried. Since Hotwire bookings are non-refundable, I never considered canceling. Instead, I made sure that I had a good look-see around the room for any signs of the critters but failed to find any. I'm sure this is a bit of an issue in many places in New York these days, so I'd be careful anywhere you stayed, just to be safe. There's an above average breakfast served in the morning, with your basic cold and dry foods, but supplemented with a couple of steam pans with hot items like eggs, bacon, and biscuits. The breakfast area is next to the lobby and looks out on to the street and there's a generous patio area as well for those who like to dine al fresco. I also used the gym which is downstairs. if you want a Coke at 2am, there are vending machines in the lower level as well. All in all, a solid choice at a price that's more than fair for the location. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for attractions”
Reviews.Author: 1969ws
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. The rooms are small but clean and adequate. Our room was at the rear on the 12th floor. Although the view wasn't that great of the offices behind it was very quiet. We had a large jacuzzi bath which was simply delightful after a long days sightseeing. The breakfasts were better than expected. Cakes, fruit, yoghurts, limited hot items such as omelettes, scrambled eggs and sausages, more than enough to set you up for the day. Hot drinks are free and available 24/7 which again was nice coming in from the freezing winds and snow. The staff were always very helpful and friendly. Bags can be left foc on the day of departure which was also handy. Overall a good base for a short stay in the Big Apple!

Reviews.Title: “Good price, good hotel, good breakfast, but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: gobitz
Reviews.Content: In New York you can't expect large rooms, and this hotel is one example of that. The rooms are very small, with an old tube tv. Location is great! The free breakfast is more than enough, with bagels, hot stuff, yoghurts, cereals, etc. I received a $5 Starbucks card for being a Platinum member. Nice gesture! Great service, nice people. Free tea and coffee all day long.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the Money”
Reviews.Author: thecrankytraveller
Reviews.Content: First up this hotel is well situated to get you just about anywhere quickly. You are a 5 minute stroll from Madison Square Garden, I minute walk to 28th/7th (123) station, 15min to Highline Park/Meat packing district or 20 minutes to Times Square by foot. Check in was smooth and the staff friendly. Our room was New York style small but that’s to be expected. That said it was clean and well appointed. The lifts are very old and slow, we were there over the Christmas Holiday and the place was packed, luckily we were on a high floor as most times the lift would fill up coming down and anyone lower than 7 regularly missed out. (I recommend asking for a high floor). The gym was great and we never had to wait for a piece of equipment even though the hotel was full. It has running machines, free weights and an exercise bike. Breakfast was hard work the free breakfast consisted of cereal, yoghurt, bagels, toast, cold boiled eggs, cinnamon buns but absolutely no fruit during the stay which was disappointing. The coffee was terrible. Two out of four mornings we ate standing up as the dining room is completely inadequate for the number of guests. At least 50% would cone get their stuff and head back to their room. So if you are looking for a tranquil start to your morning you won’t find it here. We had one glitch in our stay which was on the 2nd day we only received two towels, a call to house keep resulted in being told one would be sent straight up. I rang again an hour later as we were about to leave for diner (had to share after our shower) and was again told one would be sent straight up. Nothing cam and on the way out I heard a housekeeping lady say they were well short of towels as the laundry had not dropped off (this makes perfect sense as we were in the middle of a massive snow storm, if someone had of just told us this we would have been fine). Anyway we left a note and extra tip the next morning and were back to three. Check out was a breeze and the guys behind reception were extremely nice. I would definitely stay here again for this location, the price of this hotel for its location is great. I also appreciated the friendliness of the staff and cleanliness of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not enough room at the Inn...”
Reviews.Author: ll72
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Dec 25 - 28th 2010. To be fair it was Christmas, and a snow blizzard pretty much shut the city down on the 26th so I'm sure the staff were pushed to their limits at this time. A couple of frustrating moments but this place is so close to where everything is happening in New York that nothing was so bad it would stop me from staying here again. Pros: Location: One block from Madison Square Garden so within walking distance to Times Square and Theatre District. Sleep: Once my head hit the pillow I was out like a light; very comfortable (and important when we're spending all day out and about). Gym: Great free fitness room with weight bench, 2 treadmills and a bike. Cons: Free Breakfast and Facilities: This hotel was packed and fairly impossible to get a seat at breakfast time (the whole time, not just later in the morning). Most people filled their plates to take back to the room - quite a wait for one of the two elevators to get to you at that time of day. We had 3 people in our room and were unable to get a towel each to use on one day (may have had something to do with the snow storm?). Rang housekeeping 3 times and each request was just ignored. Noise: Walls are paper thing and you could hear all neighbours coming and going. Conversations in rooms of people near the lift could be easily heard - try to get a high floor away from lifts if possible. This'll make it easier getting down to the lobby in the morning's also. Have stayed at the Holiday Inn Chinatown on a previous visit to New York but would rather the Express for location and value for $$$.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and midtown location in NYC”
Reviews.Author: LAPeach
Reviews.Content: Great location in midtown. Easy to get to: Airtrain to Jmaica station transfer to Long Island railroad train (LIRR) for Penn station; exit on 7th Ave /32nd and walk to 29th St. LIRR is much faster than subway. Clean hotel, nice sized room for NYC, widescreen TV, free internet, typical HI breakfast. Macy's main store is three blocks (catacorner Penn Station) and many restaurants and sights within walking distance. King Tut exhibit at Discovery Times Square Theater was fantastic; very different than earlier exhibit but just as entertaining and actually more informative.

Reviews.Title: “I love New York”
Reviews.Author: natashacampbell77
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel good location, quiet street, easy 10 min walk to Times Square. Felt very safe coming and going from hotel late at night. Close to subway. Room was small, but we had heard that NY hotel rooms were tiny, so I was expecting the worst, but was no where near as small as the horror stories I"d heard. Very helpful and friendly front desk staff and great free internet access in lobby,( 3 computers ) Would recommend

Reviews.Title: “A very nice, affordable hotel. Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: SupernovaSurvivor
Reviews.Content: I was slightly worried when I made the reservations. Especially since the Bedbugs craze going on in NYC… I didn't quite know what to expect from a 2.5 star hotel. But it didn't let me down – I was even pleasantly surprised. The rooms are VERY clean, cozy and not too small. The bed is big and comfortable. It's true that the hotel is a bit noisy – you can hear everything that's going on in the hall (including the loud house keeping service), the bathroom doors do slam, and the air-conditioning slightly stutters… but than again, it doesn’t disturb you that much. The complementary breakfast is very nice and tasty. However, I can confirm that indeed there aren't enough seats in the tiny dining hall. We took our breakfast up to our room - like some others did. The staff was very kind. I had a little trouble getting information over the phone, but face-to-face they are friendlier. The location is lovely. Though a word of warning to animal-right fighters – the hotel is in the middle of a street dedicated to stores that sell real furs.. =p As far as value for money - it's an excellent hotel. Much cheaper than any other decent hotel that I've looked up. To conclude: I'd definitely recommend this hotel for anyone who's looking for a simple, good and affordable hotel from which to explore the wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay if you're playing in NYC.”
Reviews.Author: johnciii
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here (SAME DAY, ON A SATURDAY, 2 WEEKS BEFORE CHRISTMAS IN NYC!!!) through one of the major travel websites, and got the room for much cheaper than I could find anywhere else. When you're in the city that doesn't sleep, all you need is a bed to collapse into and this hotel serves quite nicely. The rooms are SPOTLESSLY clean and efficient, and the staff are absolutely sweethearts. My King Non-smoking room was larger than I expected. You're not staying here for scenery so don't expect any. What you are here for is location, and if you are attending an event at MSG or the Javits center, you are only blocks away. Definitely a great place to stay in the city. Great breakfast too.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location, will come agan”
Reviews.Author: yb1974
Reviews.Content: relatively large room for NYC, very clean, great service. the hotel is at a great location, 15 minutes walk from Times Sq and other tourist attractions. Close to restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: formersec
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel. The rooms and other parts of the hotel are clean and neat. The shower and bath work properly. The beds were comfortable. The service from everyone -- front desk to housekeeping -- was excellent. It didn't have a lot of ameneties and the room was small, but for the price, this is a good hotel to stay in. If you're looking for a hotel to stay in New York City that is comfortable and affordable, but not necessarily luxurious, this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in town”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter25
Reviews.Content: It is a clean hotel in a good location, free breakfast and quiet. In comparison to any other hotel I stayed in in new york the value is unbeatable for the price. You have no bar or restaurant and the rooms are simple, basic and functional. But if you are in NY to see the city that is all that you need, The service is fantastic, my hairdryer did not work and the repaiman was at our room within 5 minutes to fix it. Breakfast is good, sweet and salty for every taste. Not a luxury place, but for the price you are paying nobody expects that. I will definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very clean with good service”
Reviews.Author: Waltonx4
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the NYC Marathon Weekend - smaller rooms but very clean. Walked and took subway everywhere (7 day pass for $27). Breakfast better than average - hot eggs and sausage. Computers with printers in lobby. Staff very helpful with tourist information. Hockey sports bar on 7th Ave & 29th St.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & good location. Free breakfast & wifi. Just a bit noisy!”
Reviews.Author: karen_kir
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small which is to be expected in NYC, but they are clean and have what you need. There is free wifi and breakfast in the lobby (plus free coffee and tea all day). Not too far from Penn station, just a 2 minute walk and then just get the subway - so location is great. Biggest issue is the noise. The doors all SLAM. Including the bathroom doors. So from 8am, all you hear is "house keeping! knock knock. slam. slam. slam." I put a towell in the door jam of the bathroom to stop it from closing and slaming, but you still hear (and feel!) every neighbour go in an out of their bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable accommodation”
Reviews.Author: zillabong
Reviews.Content: Rooms clean and comfortable, free wifi in room and 3 computers in lobby. 15-20 minute walk to Times Square, lots of cafe's, bars nearby. Breakfast average but hey it's free. If stayed in NY again would stay closer to Times Square as it's closer to theatre's, shopping, eateries etc. Used Hop on Hop off bus, great value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our Family!!!”
Reviews.Author: ricomillerfamily
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st visit to NYC & it was famtastic. Thanks to this hotel, it was centrally located to walk everywhere & if be we can't walk, take a taxi & it's also close to subway 28th St or Penn station. Walking distance to Time Square & other places. Make sure you have good walking shoes. I bought Dr. Schols & they worked great in all my shoes. The breakfast area was quite surprising they not only have fruit, begals & yogurt, they also have hot food. You do have to get there early to get the full effect. The staff was friendly & I loved also the business area you can use there computer & print out whatever you need. I recommend New York City pass, & restaurants.com we chose Alpha Fusion on 8th Ave. & it was close & super yummy. I already miss this hotel I slept like it was my own bed. Very comfortable for me. If you stay here you will not be disappointed. The only down fall the room was a bit small for a family of 4. It was me, my husband, 21 year old son & 22 year old son. I guess you can say we bonded, cuz we had no other choice. lol

Reviews.Title: “Great value - no complaints”
Reviews.Author: Winterpeg1Winnipeg
Reviews.Content: Just returned home and want to make sure I don't forget to review this hotel. It was a pleasant surprise! Rooms were fine, breakfast was adequate and the staff was excellent. The location was great - we anticipated taking lots of taxis but in fact, we walked almost everywhere we went. After a busy day sightseeing, we'd return late afternoon, grab a snack at the Pret a Manger at the corner, relax a bit and then head out for the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great option in NYC”
Reviews.Author: DCTerry
Reviews.Content: This is exactly what you expect from a Holiday Inn Express-- clean and good price. There was a large breakfast buffet. Our room was a fine size and had everything we needed. Excellent location. I'd go back. Not sure where people are getting these ideas about big hotel rooms in NYC. Space is a premium in Manhattan and unless you're willing to pay for it, rooms are small. Get over it.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly good location and good complimentery breakfast but bedroom and bathroom small”
Reviews.Author: neepdocker
Reviews.Content: It's Manhattan so I suppose we have to expect rooms with small bathrooms but the bathroom had to have the door fully open or fully closed to be able to move in it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money - breakfast included”
Reviews.Author: KirstyMason
Reviews.Content: A good place to stay in New York, close to Subway, 20 minute walk to Times Square, lots of easy dinner options and Starbucks nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience, super city!”
Reviews.Author: Habsfan80
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through ebookers after reviewing comments and those have been confirmed. For the location (next to Madison Square Garden), the price was really good. The reception area is probably a bit too small as it was always crowded and we had to queue for check in. We requested an extra bed but there was no space and therefore they couldn't assist. The bathroom as well as the room itself is quite small and it was difficult to find space to store our luggage as we shared the room 3 together. Apart from that, we were quite happy with the service. We had free WI-FI access for the whole stay and also coffee and muffins are in the entrance area for free. There was also a gym downstairs but didn't make use. There are many restaurants close to the hotel and as mentioned, it's just a 5 minutes walk to Broadway and 10 minutes to Times Square. Best subway station to reach the hotel is Penn Station. Overall, good experience and would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in the heart of Manhattan, perfect location for the Garden”
Reviews.Author: kklaus6
Reviews.Content: We stayed there over a weekend for 4 nights in november. The hotel is near the Garden, which was perfect for us. I bought concert tickets online, which were sent directly to the hotel. I had to call the reception a few times, but the staff was very friendly and helpful. I recived the shipping at my arrive at the hotel. The room was clean, small but comfortable. Wireless was for free and working well. Breakfast was good, a bit crowded at peak times. Overall a very good place to stay in the heart of Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Clean, Central Hotel but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Idlepair
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a relatively quiet street close to Penn Station and not too far from Midtown attractions. It was spotlessly clean and comfortable although the room was very small and lacked sufficient storage space. The air conditioning was effective but noisy. The included buffet breakfast was good but there could be a problem getting a table at peak times. The breakfast comprised: cereals (skimmed, 2%, and half & half milk), porridge (instant, add hot water), cinnamon buns and other pastries, wholemeal bread and bagels for toasting, with a wide variety of jams, honey, peanut butter and syrup. There was a fridge with hard boiled eggs, yogurts, cream cheese and butter, and a hot food display with scrambled eggs and "sausage gravy" (a creamy goo with brown flecks). There was a fruit juice dispenser (orange, apple, cranberry, all tasted a bit "thin") and fresh bananas. The coffee was good (cardboard cups), and there was a variety of tea bags, but not earl grey. All the other crockery was polystyrene, and the cutlery plastic, so the whole lot went into the bin afterwards. The staff worked hard to ensure food and drink was always topped up. We found all of the hotel staff friendly and helpful. There were 3 computers available to guests in reception, with free Wi-fi and use of a printer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Loction, great deal”
Reviews.Author: WorldChef1
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews I was a bit concerned. I am so glad to report bad reviews I found un founded. The place was clean, the price was great the location was perfect for our sightseeing to Chelsea, Time Sqaure and Greenich Village. Hotel staff at the front desk was great al but one guy who seemed lost. The ladies at the front desk where great. The breakfast was not the best, but heck it was all included and not bad after a long night out on the town. Room was clean. Hotel maid service is lacking in professional decorum, but tollerable. I would stay here again and I would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Had to buy bite cream! Will not be returning”
Reviews.Author: greenbee99
Reviews.Content: Have been to NY three times and this was the worst hotel. Rooms very basic and charged 5 dollars for a small bottle of water. Rooms small, which is not the standard of NY. Two previous hotels I have stayed in, had large rooms. Carpet smelt musty and wary of the bed. Stayed the first night in full length PJ's. Second night in shorts and woke up covered in bed bugs bite. One so. Big, my leg swelled up. If you do stay here recommend you sleep completely covered and bring slippers! Room facilities fairly clean. Wi-fi free however could not get it to work on my laptop. Had three computers downstairs which was free but no chairs to sit on so uncomfortable to use. Easy access to penn station and broadway however off the main road so did not feel comfortable walking alone at night. Reception hectic for checking in, checking out was even worse, at least 40 people in reception, not good when on a tight deadline. Breakfast area fairly non existent, small and limited choice. Had a bagel every morning. Plus side to hotel, not far from maceys and victoria secrets! Had a meal in a restaurant in central park. Very expensive but a lovely experience. Be wary of the guys who take you for a bike ride - prices are per person, not that they tell you that so was ripped of! Not the best of experiences in a hotel and sure will not return for more bed bites

Reviews.Title: “Going back every year!!”
Reviews.Author: CandiceMitchell88
Reviews.Content: We checked in mid-afternoon. Place was clean and very well kept. Front desk was great help in giving us discounted tickets for attractions too! Breakfast was always refreshed and had a great selection of food. Only down side was a pair of shoes went missing from our room, but I was reimbursed for 1 day. Room was fair in size, perfect for the two of us, and the king size bed was super comfy!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone! We're actually making it a yearly trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Girls NYC Weekend”
Reviews.Author: tvsv3726
Reviews.Content: Eight of us stayed in this hotel August 13th & 14th, 2010. I have stayed in other hotels in this same area, The New Yorker for one, but I will make this my home base from now on. We came into Penn Station and it was a very short walk to the hotel. The breakfast was great, the staff was very friendly, the hotel was very clean, I just can't say enough. We enjoyed the patio area outside very much. In fact we even ate a couple of meals outside. Location is everything, and this hotel had it.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the value”
Reviews.Author: pricetax
Reviews.Content: The TA reviews were accurate on this one. Our stay was a week Tues thru Sun. We arrived early, however was offered to hold our luggage till we could check in. The room was updated and very clean, however small. This is standard for NYC. The breakfast was good, did not expereience the LARGE crowds previously mentioned. There were times where it was full but everyone moved through and the outside patio was very ice. The front desk personnel were great expecially Lydia. Two young women walking through the area late at night was a little nerving but we had no problems. I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly people, good value”
Reviews.Author: jaybar1
Reviews.Content: I spent two days in early June. Location is superb so close to Penn Station. Continental breakfast is awesome for a person who wants to get rolling in the morning for site seeing. They even have a couple of computers in the lobby so one can check their email if needed and see if flight is one time. Angela front office manager is awesome as is the manager who is a hands on guy. Definitely plan to stay there again when in NYC. Location is so great in midtown with some neat restaurants and shops nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: bikercindy
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to NYC. Three couples stayed at this hotel the first week of August. Convenient location to Empire State Bldg., Times Square, Penn Station, subway connections. Clean rooms, lobby, breakfast bar area. Efficient, friendly and helpful staff. The courtyard in front of the hotel and several six-packs of beverage from nearby deli were our decompressors late evenings. No mosquitos. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Dinesh R
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was amazing, close to Penn Station and a few blocks away from attractions incl Time Square and tour operators though the immediate neighbourhood was quiet. Parking options are close at hand. We found the rooms clean and the service quite good. A decent breakfast was incl in our package and that just made it great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “OK location, clean, but hectic breakfast”
Reviews.Author: carrmanor100
Reviews.Content: The location is ok to good as it is about a 15minute (20mins at the end of a tiring day!) walk to Times Square. However it is only a few minutes walk to Madison Square Gardens (as the name would suggest). The room size is relatively small however people say that most hotel rooms in NY are small so I can't really grumble about that. The hotel was modern and clean however the noise could be heard somewhat from the corridors. Breakfast was so hectic is was nearly worth not bothering. There were not enough tables by half. You could never move and getting a table was a miracle. However the food offered was actually to a good standard with a reasonable selection. All in all, fine for what we wanted - a value for money hotel is a reasonably good location but if I went to NY again, I'd maybe consider paying a little extra to be slightly closer to the action and as previously mentioned, the breakfast situation in a morning was a little too hectic for my liking. But overall, not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Defintely will stay at this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: ONEMEAUX
Reviews.Content: When we checked in we were greeted by Gloria the front desk clerk she was great and provided excellent customer service give her a promotion or a raise . Gloria explained to us all the services the hotel provided the free wi-fi ,the hours for breakfast and several other services that I wasn't aware of and answered any questions I had. We went up to the room it was very clean but we only had towels for 3 people we had four I went down and spoke to Gloria before leaving to grab a bite to eat and she apologized for and said that extra towels would be in the room when we returned and they were . The staff from the maintenace guys to the hostesses preparing the breakfast every morning they all freindly and would greet us and ask us about how we were enjoying our stay whenever we saw them they made you feel welocomed in all the years I have visited and stayed in many hotels here New York this by far was the best hotel staff I ever encountered. You can't beat the location you are within a few short blocks of Times Square, 7th Avenue restaurants etc.. Put on some good walking shoes and enjoy the sights no taxi needed.

Reviews.Title: “Good bet for a trouble-free stay”
Reviews.Author: randgust
Reviews.Content: Never having been in NYC before I told my wife to search Trip Advisor HARD and she found this one. We came in on Amtrak and this is in luggage-dragging range of Penn Station, the subway, and my sons apartment. After reading awful reviews of some NYC hotels and getting price-shocked by others, this is a good safe bet. Its a conversion, the rooms are some of the smallest I've seen, but the condition was excellent. The standard HIX breakfast people should take lessons here. This place was absolutely packed, and they never ran out of anything. Until somebody comes up with a better price-location combination (and I didn't see anything in the neighborhood even close) this is where I'd come back to. Oh, one more thing, leave the car at home and come in by train. Sure glad we did.

Reviews.Title: “Good location-excellent service”
Reviews.Author: kdwait
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the July 4th weekend and found the Holiday Inn Express to be a great value for Manhatten. We arrived a bit early for check-in and our bags were stored safely and were easy to retrieve when we returned to the hotel. As it has been said-the location is very convenient. Breakfast time is BUSY-but always lots to choose from-we enjoyed eating outside every morning. Yes the rooms are small-I totally expected this in NYC--it was not unbearable, even with two teenagers!! The room was clean, we did have to request more towels a couple of times, but my daughter left a note for housekeeping one morning and from then on we had plenty of towels! On our last day, we had a late flight out and once again our bags were stored safely for the day. I would definitely stay here again--NYC was fantastic as always!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “step out into chelsea”
Reviews.Author: PinoCheltenham
Reviews.Content: For what you get it is very good value, great location - one block away from MSG, near Penn station, Macys and in Chelsea which you can roam around. Breakfast was included, no safe in room, but safe deposit box. Rooms are small, but hey it's Manhatten- how cares.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of booking w/Hotels.com”
Reviews.Author: Proseco
Reviews.Content: I booked w/hotels.com and was emphatic w/them that I needed a room w/2 double beds. I repeated this w/them and received an email confirmation of it. When I arrived at the hotel early afternoon, I was told that the fri nite stay would be a queen w/rollaway instead because hotels.com just books with HIE as a "standard" room and they were sold out of those rooms. I had to change rooms the next day which is a major inconvenience for anyone. I would like to site a desk reservation agent who was especially kind and helpful---Topacio. Our first room was upper floor and very clean. This was not the case when we moved, but she assured me that the bathroom would be cleaned again for us and was true to her word. Free internet in lobby was helpful; bkfst of yogurt/cereal was sufficient for us. There is a Whole Foods not far from hotel which is helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE”
Reviews.Author: lupachinok
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and staff was very friendly. Free breakfast in the morning was even better, you are able to sit outside and enjoy your breakfast while you enjoy people watching. I actually stayed there twice and had a great experience each time. Location is even better as long as you dont mind walking. Of ocurse it is a little loud but thats to be expected for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: maried11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend, July 1 - 4 and really enjoyed this hotel. The price was great at $109/nt. and the hotel was super clean. We had no wait at check in or out, at the elevators or at the computer. One morning we did have to wait for the printer though. We thought it was a great location. We could walk easily to Times Square, different subway locations, Penn Station for the Amtrak to Newark Airport, the Empire States building and quite a few bars for a drink at night. We always felt safe and every morning we made an egg, cheese and sausage biscuit before heading out. That would tide us over for a brunch later in the day. I thoroughly enjoyed our stay and as a travel agent would recommend it to anyone. Away from the crazyiness of Times Square (and the price), but close enough that you didn't need to take a cab. I would return anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Good but could do with a few improvements”
Reviews.Author: cookie_crumble90
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. When we arrived check in was really fast. We booked a room with a king size bed. I did find the room a bit small but I wasnt expecting it to be big. Free wifi was included which was very useful. When we tried to use the shower for the first time we didnt know how to work it. There were no instructions in the room provided, so we just presumed that you moved the handle to the left and the shower would turn on but oh no. In the end we had to contact reception. I have to admit that I have never used such a complicated shower in my whole life. Not to mention the small bath towels we had, I think they must of been designed for people with dwafism or something. The doors felt like they were made out of cardboard, they were not soundproof at all, even if somebody was whispering about 15 feet away from your door you could hear every word. Also the air conditioning in our room was so loud. Infact it was so loud that it was enough to wake up a dead person. The hotel in general was quite noisy, especially for the first 2 nights we were there, we had these really loud spanish people in the 2 rooms opposite from our room and I think they were up all night running up and down the corridors, slamming doors and just being generally noisy. It was ridiculous the amount of noise they were making and since the doors are so thin when they were talking it actually sounded like they were in the room with us, which is kind of freaky. The dining room (if thats what you want to call it) was like a stampede. The hall was not big enough and there were not enough tables, I even saw some people eating their breakfast standing up because there were no tables. And since all of the food was free people were just taking whatever they could get their hands on wether they ate it or not. One day there were no bananas left because one person decided to take 5 of them! The dining room nearly went up in flames one day because somebody put a scone through the toaster! They had a very weird selection of foods such as beefburgers and scones. Who would eat beefburgers for breakfast?! I know I certainly wouldnt. Besides the only things that were edible in there were the cereal and toast. But since it was included in the price, Im not really going to complain that much. It was excellent that the coffee was provided all day free of charge. So we took advantage of that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice-excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: VABEACH23456
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but compliments for this hotel. The staff was the kindest and most helpful I have encountered in several trips to New York. One front office employee whose name started with an I(sorry I can't remember) even called my cell phone while we were out touring to let us know our room was ready early. The breakfast was great, and although it was crowded, the outside table provided extra seating in a nice setting. The food was very good for a complimentary breakfast. The room was clean and although we had four in the room and only got three towels, more were brought within minutes of a phone call. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable rooms in a central location.”
Reviews.Author: nak12
Reviews.Content: My only guidelines for picking a hotel to stay in is that it be clean, safe and affordable. This hotel exceeded those requirements. While the room was a bit tight for four people, it had everything we needed and was very clean and quiet. The staff were very helpful and friendly. While the location wasn't right next to any major tourist attractions, it was only a short cab/subway ride away from most places. In a few minutes we could be in either Times Square or SoHo. The only thing that could be improved upon would be to have a few more healthier options for the complimentary breakfast. I should also add that I was warned about the bedbug situation in New York City just before my trip and was told what to look out for. We checked everything in the room as soon as we got there and I am happy to say that we didn't see/get bitten by a single bug.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Clean with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: idallas
Reviews.Content: A great hotel for the money we spent. The inclusive breakfast was popular and always well stocked. Free coffee 24 hours a day was also very welcome! The location is ideal for getting around and it felt like a good secure neigbourhood. The staff were always polite and very helpful and always seemed to have a smile on their faces. The only downside for us was the size of the rooms. We were there for 5 nights with 2 x young children and after a whil eit did get a bit claustrophobic! But the room was cleaned every day with fresh towels etc. Would I go back?? Yes!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, very helpful staff and excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: biz_plan_man
Reviews.Content: I satyed at this hotel and they allowed me to do an early check-in at 8 AM. Nice breakfast, very good location and excellent staff. I would always stay at this hotel when in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: SCDC2620
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the HIE Madison Square in 2008. When we decided to come back to the New York again this year this was the only hotel we considered. The HIE Madison Square might not be the biggest or best, but its location in midtown within walking distance to the main tourist districts (theatres, shopping and Times Square) and a number of Metro Stations means everything in Manhattan and greater New York are easily reached. The hotel itself is very clean and comfortable with all conveniences that you need and expect. The staff that we dealt with were very pleasant and helpful. Checkin and out was fuss free. Plus the HIE's included breakfast keeps the Manhattan costs under control.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for good price”
Reviews.Author: Cryjam
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located two blocks from Madison Sq Garden/Penn train station which makes getting around NYC easy. You can also walk to Time Sq, Empire State Building and Broadway. The hotel is new, the rooms are a good size with all the standard hotel features. A complimentary breakfast is provided and whilst lots of food is provided seating is limited so be prepared to take your breakfast but to your room. The hotel is primarily a tourist hotel with some tour groups staying however we were not effected except for breakfast and the worlds slowest elevator. NYC doesn't need me to sell it but this is a great base to explore from particularly for those looking for value. The hotel is a little hidden, so walking from Penn St (south) get to 29 st and turn right down a street that looks like a service lane and the hotel is half way along - the area is actually quiet safe from our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good location / friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Pocis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 8 nights while in New York. The location is great. Just two blocks south of Madison Square Garden. We stayed on the 5th floor the first night but asked to be change to a higher floor due to that I heard a base bump from a club or something all night. We got a room on the 12th floor and no problems with noise levels at all on that floor. The staff was really friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and served their purpose - a place to sleep during a lovely visit to new york. The hotel has 3 computors in the lobby with printers that the guests can use free-of-charge. Perfect if you want to book things via the internet. You can also free-of-charge borrow a deposit box during your stay. The breakfast area is too small for the size of the hotel, but that might not be a problem in the summer when the guests can sit outside and eat their breakfast. I can definetaly see myself staying at the hotel again and I would recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: WarwickshireDawn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early April for 5 nights and were very pleased with the location and standard of accommodation - we definitely think we had good value for money. Walking to Times Square is quick and easy and an underground station is nearby too. The breakfast area is busy but we didn't wait long for a table. Staff top up the food regularly and there is an ample choice including cereals, yogurts, muffins/bagels etc. Coffee and tea is available throughout the day, you just help yourself from the breakfast area. We would definitely stay here again and would recommend the hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: hipnhappy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights during early April, we had a room on the 12th floor with 2 double beds and a view of the ESB. We had absolutely no complaints, yes breakfast is chaotic, but so is the rest of New York and yes, there were police/fire/ambulance sirens and lots of people noise again that is New York, best thing is if you want a countryside holiday go to the countryside but if you want a great hotel in a fabulous,fun city then I would recommend this hotel it is close to Penn Station, which means getting around the city and to and from the airport is easy.

Reviews.Title: “great price for clean hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: displacedandrew
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 4 day trip and didn't want something too expensive but with a good location. This hotel had a great price for the location and the rooms were clean and comfortable. Price can't be beat and I would recommend this hotel to travellers looking for something comfortable and close but with a lower price.

Reviews.Title: “No noise isolation”
Reviews.Author: Lve2travel14
Reviews.Content: Great location. Clean hotel, service good. The big issue was sound isolation. All the doors, room and bathroom doors are spring loaded and slam. This creates an almost 24 hour cacophony of door slamming. No doubt that the clubs in NY closed at 4, because at about 4:15 we were awakened by door slamming, talking, etc. Some was in the hallway, but most from rooms, even rooms across the hall.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SG0823
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with my stay at the Holiday Inn Express in NYC. The staff at the front desk were very helpful and gave information and advice about getting around the city. The location was perfect. We rode the train into the city and walked to the hotel from Penn Station. The continental breakfast was just what we needed to start the day. There were many choices and room to sit and eat. The room was immaculate with comfortable beds and soft towels. The free high-speed internet was easy to connect to and very fast. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Limited service hotel; spotless rooms”
Reviews.Author: davidahsgr
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times for business trips. Limited service, although the staff is friendly enough. Rooms are very small, as are many in Manhattan, so I would not stay here with a family. But I have never found it anything but scrupulously clean, and that matters a lot more to me that fancy amenities. They did away with their business center, and have put in a few internet-enabled computers in the lobby so you can print directions or quickly check e-mail. Always loaded with foreign tourists so fun to hear many languages. There is a teeny workout room with a few treadmills and bicycles; works fine. Location is OK; between two busy avenues and easy walking to Madison Sq Garden/Penn Station and 7th Avenue/Fashion Avenue. Subway right around the corner so you can get anywhere. A little icky at night; homeless folks in the doorways of nearby buildings, etc., although I have never felt unsafe. They should post a guard full-time outside the elevator to check keys but do not always have someone there. I don't think I would be comfortable here if I were a female traveling alone. *Always* check on line a few days before you travel, as they have some very low rates show up on their website a few days before availability. I have stayed here for as little as $119 +taxes (of which there are a lot in NYC), including a stay in March 2010. I find this hotel a tremendous value and it's one of my preferred spots when I'm just staying overnight on business.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: S2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days in late March. We got the hotel using hotwire.com and were pleased with the stay. The hotel had comfortable and very clean rooms. We had the choice of a king sized bed or 2 doubles, wifi internet in the rooms (plus they had 3 internet stations in the lobby). We also liked the location of the hotel (close to MSG, TImes Square, Penn station/subway) while being on a quiet street. Breakfast was ok...really busy but not much you can do about that. We liked the 24 hr coffee/tea and water that was offered. FYI, we took a shuttle from LaGuardia Airport for $5.00/person (company was called NYAS...look for person wear blue jackets)which dropped us off at Penn station. From there we just walked which took less than 5 min. To go back to the airport we took the same shuttle company which does a pick up at the NE corner of W34th Street and 7th Ave every 30 mins at 10 and 40 on the hour. We paid $12/person going back to LGA. Sure beats paying $40+ for a taxi! Overall we enjoyed our stay at Holiday Inn Express MSG and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: amaybride
Reviews.Content: I would absoulty recommend this hotel to anyone. It is in a great location. On 29th Street in between 7th & 8th Aves. Penn Station & Madison Square Gardens are just a few blocks away. Times Square starts around 42nd St & that's even a easy walk. Everyone that works here that we dealt with from maintance, housekeeping, breakfast person to the front desk was awesome! I have to give extra kudos to Topacio that worked the front desk. She was so awesome. She went above & beyond her job description to make my sisters & I stay in NYC that much better. Thank you Topacio. We will stay here again on our next NYC trip. There are only 2 things that I would suggest staying away from. 1. Try and not get a room on C level. It's the lowest level of the hotel. Only floor with vending machines. Our first night there was bad because our room was on the C level next to the stairwell & all night long the stairway door was opening & slamming closed & people using the vending machine. The next day we switched rooms without any problem. 2. The hotel offers a shuttle to the airport via a 3rd party. It is not ran by the hotel. We opted to do this. It's $20 per person. The problem with this is that it picks up more people than just you from different hotel locations (we didn't know that). We were in the van for about 1 hour before actually heading to the airport because the shuttle had 4 more stops after he picked us up. So I would not recommend this shuttle. Just hail a taxi!

Reviews.Title: “What a delightful place”
Reviews.Author: HappyTrailsCpl
Reviews.Content: The girls decided to take a shopping holiday to New York. I'm so happy we stayed at the Holiday Inn Express MSG. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. We only paid 129US for a very comfortable room. Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CathyV3
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel...clean, roomy (for NYC), great breakfast and friendly staff. The only glitch was when one day they didn't clean the room, and when I called the front desk to let them know, the appologized, but didn't do anything about it :( Other than that (which I'm sure is a rare case) it was wonderful!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: BJC84
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located 2 blocks downtown from New York Penn Station between 7th and 8 th Avenue, around a 5-10 minute walk. It is central for everything including the train and bus station if you want to go futher afield. Check was good and quick, the room size was adequate and no different to any other major city in the world. Breakfast was OK and you help yourself to as little or much as you like, it is small for the number of rooms though. You do need to pick your time as it can get busy, on the plus side Tea/Coffee is available all day in the foyer (handy for us as it was cold whilst we were there). Other benefits are 3 internet machines in the lobby, safety deposit box (no charge just ask at reception), an outside garden area both back and front. The receptionists are really helpful and worth asking if you have any questions at all. Getting to and from the hotel was easy, but recomend contacting the hotel for the shuttle service which is door to door. Going in we paid $30 ($15 ea) for the shuttle and train which took around an hour and half, coming out we paid $40 ($20 ea) was picked up at the hotel and dropped at the terminal. The return took less time even taking into account pick ups at other hotels, they can arrange a private pick up for around $80. We will go back to New York someday (soon hopefully) and will not hestitiate in booking with them.

Reviews.Title: “LOUDEST HOTEL YOU WILL EVER SLEEP IN-BAR NONE”
Reviews.Author: travelguy46375
Reviews.Content: Ever want to hear all kinds of loud noises through paper thin walls starting at 2am till 7am???? Ever want to have maids knocking on your door in the morning regardless of the do not disturb sign on the door?? Well look no further! The walls of this place are thinner then a human hair, the place is very scary.. DO NOT STAY HERE. WE HATED IT... HAAAAAA-TED-IT -RM

Reviews.Title: “Location location location!”
Reviews.Author: hayeda
Reviews.Content: Want to enjoy NYC to the fullest? What better place than the middle of Madison Square Garden? The location is absolutely fabulous. Walking distance to many of the main attractions. The rooms are smallish by world-wide standards, but perfectly good for NYC. The rooms are new and clean, has everything a traveler would need. Very attentive receptionists. They helped us get a discounted parking spot in a nearby lot and stored our luggage on our last day. There is free internet stations in the lobby. Coffee available almost all hours of the day. Breakfast was pretty decent. And I got an incredible deal LastMinuteTravel.com. I reserved without knowing the name of the hotel (but I could actually guess what is was based on descriptions available) and got the double room for 150$ per night in September! It is just impossible to beat that deal in anywhere downtown in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Will be back - clean, pleasant staff, super close to NYP and MSG.”
Reviews.Author: JorMolchan
Reviews.Content: For the price and especially if you're coming via Penn Station it can't be beat. Very clean, comfortable bed, pleasant staff, super close to Penn Station and Madison Square Garden. I'll likely use this same hotel on my next trip. I walked to Penn Station in less than 10 minutes, with baggage. Check in was easy, check out was unnecessary. The room (one king bed) was small but about right for NYC and the price. In my room I heard a little bit of street noise on the 11th floor but nothing to wake me or keep me up. I heard my neighbor's door shutting but again it didn't wake me. Breakfast had cereals, fruit, sausage, biscuits and a few other items plus coffee, juice and milk. There were a lot of people at breakfast (looked like tourists) but I found a table.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: trisheeOttawa
Reviews.Content: Well located, small but comfortable clean room, large TV, good hot breakfast. All of the many staff that we dealt with were helpful and friendly. Clearly the management here make a point of training staff well. For 99 bucks/ night, what more can you want in Manhattan?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: BeHappy65
Reviews.Content: Great location right round the corner from Madison Square Gardens. Macy's, Empire State Building, Times Square, Metro are all within easy walking distance. The breakfast was fantastic - juices, toast, hot breakfast, cereals, fruit, great to fill up and then not eat until early evening. Tea and coffee is available all the time. The hotel was good, staff pleasant and helpful. The room sizes were OK considering we were in NYC, we had two queen beds in our room. We found ripped and dirty mattress cover sheets on one of them, which is not very nice. Apart from that we had a great stay there and would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “EXTREMELY friendly”
Reviews.Author: VTtraveler09
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 930am, check in was 4pm. They checked us into a room. If a room wasn't available they would have held our bags for us. The next day we checked out and left our bags there. The staff was very accommodating and friendly, not to mention very helpful. I would recommend staying here and will look into this hotel when i return to the city again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great hotel staff, very nice room with a great view!”
Reviews.Author: live_y0ur_life
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in New-York City and this hotel was the perfect choice. We didn't know what to expect when we first booked but we were extremely happy when we arrived at the hotel. We got an early check-in and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We had an awesome view of the empire state building from our room and the hotel was in a perfect location (10 blocks from times square, 2 block from madison square gardens...)! We will definetly be booking at this location again! Great first visit to NYC!!!

Reviews.Title: “great value, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: jillian29
Reviews.Content: this hotel is spacious, free breakfast, clean clean and staff is friendly and helpful. It is not on the prettiest of streets, but 2 blks from Penn, which is why I chose this hotel. Two blocks to the subway #1 line....This was my first time away from midtown and would stay again, tho maybe in the warmer weather,,,,

Reviews.Title: “All in one, what you can ask for in NYC for a good price”
Reviews.Author: PR_Young_traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Good price and includes breakfast, which is enought for starting your day. The rooms are big, clean and comfortable. The service is great. They easily helped me change my room from a king to a double bed and gave me great service on a couple of occasions. They have wireless service and a computer on the lobby and coffee on the lobby 24/7. The location is great because it is really close to 2 train stations which is all that you need on NYC. On my stay on NYC i also stayed on Hilton Garden Inn and here. I have to say that Hilton Garden Inn (times square) is very centrally located and the room is big and luxurious but you have to pay for it. Even with a great deal I got I payed more for the hilton than this hotel and without breakfast or anything, so I think this one is a good deal

Reviews.Title: “New Year's visit”
Reviews.Author: gh0ti
Reviews.Content: Had a very pleasant stay at this hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the hotel is nice and central. A little expensive, but I guess everyone hikes their prices for New Year's. One note: if you're planning a New Year's visit to New York, TICKETS are required in order to gain entry to any area that can see the ball drop in Times Square. We didn't know this, so celebrated midnight in a restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pookyjen11
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel and it is very nice. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Each morning there is a full continental breakfast and coffee served all day long. The rooms are very nice and housekeeping does a great job.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location, Superb Price”
Reviews.Author: tobietrice86
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights between Christmas and New Year. Took a taxi to Hotel which took 45 minutes and only cost $55. Check In was very quick (5 mins). Hotel room was fine, good size, king sized bed and large Tv with 30+ channels. Bathroom decent size with bath and shower. Breakfast was not great. The breakfast items avaliable are very good but there breakfast room is simply too small for a 15+ floor hotel. We arrived the first morning at around 8am and there were no seats. It was stuffy, overcrowded and not great first thing in the morning. We never had breakfast again - we went to Fresco 2 mins round the block which was very fresh, healthy and cheap. The service by the staff was great and it was good to be able to leave luggage at the hotel after checkout on our last day. There are also 3 Pc's in reception which are free for guests to use. Wi-Fi is also free throughout the hotel. It was fast, efficient and was always able to get a connection straight away. Local phone calls using room phone was also free so great for making restauraunt reservations. We paid $850 for six nights which is half the price of other places of a similar range located in Manhattan close to times square.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Clean, Friendly”
Reviews.Author: DinerFan57
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself is fine, staff are friendly, rooms are a good size, the free Wireless Internet works, etc. Breakfast choice was good, but rather than scrabble to find a table we went down, picked up what we wanted and took it back to our room. Location is a short walk from Penn Station. We didn't want or expect luxury so for us this was just fine. A word of "caution" - avoid any room on the "C" floor near the Gym, we had no choice for 1 night and it was noisy as the Houskeeping is also in that area. They moved us quite happily to the 10th Floor which was much quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Clean modern hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Gord_Mtl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located about 2 blocks away from Penn Station (5 minute walk at most). We arrived by taxi from La Guardia which cost about $35 and took about 20-25 minutes. The hotel looks fairly new and the facilities are very modern and simple. We stayed in a king bed room which was a good size for New York. The morning breakfast is included as it is for all Holiday Inn Express hotels. It was a good simple breakfast with breads, juice, coffee and a few hot items. It does get very busy in the breakfast room but the turnover is quite fast and if it's nice enough outside you can sit outside as well. There are quite a few restaurants along 8th and a good little bakery close by for some good afternoon treats.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: RomeoAndJuliette
Reviews.Content: I arrived in New York by train and the hotel is located only a couple blocks from Penn Station, so the location was convenient. The price was reasonable for staying in the city. The room was clean (always my top priority). The front desk staff was very friendly. Breakfast was included with the room and included a buffet with cereal, fruit, bread, pastries, coffee, eggs, etc. It was busy during the breakfast rush, but I had no problem finding a table. The wireless was free and worked great in my room. My only complaint is the noise level in the room. I could hear everything in the hallway. My neighbor was in and out of her room all night and I could hear the door open and slam shut every time.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: travelsv
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night. Small room, but had everything we needed. It's amazing how everything fitted in that small room. Breakfast was complimentary and good. Free WIFI available. Only con was that the vending machine did not work. The receptionist was helpful and gave me change for my dollar to see if that worked. They even hold your bags for you, which was really convenient for us as we checked out in the morning and took a tour of NY. The parking lot that they validate the parking for is about 2 blocks from the hotel - $24.00 for a day - Central parking. There is a parking lot right next to the Hotel - Icon parking, and is about $30 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Basketball trip”
Reviews.Author: Drysdale
Reviews.Content: Our reservations were messed up at the Penn, so tried the Holiday Inn Express MSG. Just a couple of blocks away and although the room is small, it was clean and the bathroom looked to be newly renovated. Price was right and you get a decent breakfast. Overall was satisfied with experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, spotless, brilliant service.”
Reviews.Author: travel876543
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in October. The staff on the reception desk were all unfailingly helpful and polite, happy to answer any queries. Our room was compact, but spotless. A small bathroom with shower/bath, but also exceptionally clean. The hotel is ideally situated for walking to the major sights, many places to eat nearby. Would recommend and happily stay there again. We were both very impressed and felt it offered excellent value for money. The only negative would the lifts....2 lifts for a 10(ish?) story, very bust hotel made for long waits to and from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: JoviFan
Reviews.Content: I just got back from an overnight trip at the Showboat to see Daughtry at the Trump Taj Mahal--- Trump was too much money - got a GREAT deal with the Showboat - and did not have to go outside to get to the Trump Arena!!!! Room was very large !!!! View overlooking the ocean!!!! Big bathroom with separate room for toilet!!! Downside - internet was $11.60/day....walls a little thin, but not too noisy. Staff was very helpful -would def stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared to hear everything in the hall...”
Reviews.Author: dye-abolical
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, and great location. Courteous staff. Nice breakfast. Allow me to explain the layout of this hotel, as it was very different than what I had expected. The hotel has a VERY small footprint. There were only 10 rooms on our floor. Upon our arrival, my husband needed to sleep. I found that I could hear every conversation that took place in the hallway, as well as the elevator opening and closing. I heard children cry in another room, as well as friends who had just arrived, and described in detail their plans for the evening. It was remedied slightly with a towel against the bottom of the door. We had a fan in our luggage to provide some white noise which helped, but without it, well.... It would have made for long nights.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, impeccable service in a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: WAMarathoner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after the New York Marathon. The hotel appeared to be at 100% capacity, but you would never have known that from the service. Every single person we encountered treated us like royalty. Gloria at the front desk was especially helpful and gracious. The housekeeping staff was friendly and helped us find a great Mexican restaurant in the area. The breakfast staff was busy, but kind and deferential. I can't properly convey how overwhelmed we were with the staff's care. It felt much more like a 5-star hotel than a HIE. Breakfast was great and ample. We went during the thick of it. There are 48 chairs arranged around 16 tables in groups of 2, 3, or 4. I counted because it was a concern after reading some of the previous comments. It was the expanded HIE menu including biscuits and gravy, sausage, and pre-made omelets. These were quickly refilled as necessary. Coffee is available 24 hours. Priority Club members can have their breakfast delivered, if they like. The hotel is located a block from the #1 line, or 2.5 blocks from Madison Square Garden/Penn Station. It's a block the other way from the Fashion Institute of Technology. The neighborhood is okay and felt safe walking alone at night; there was a crazy on the street, but it's New York and there are crazies on most blocks. There is a parking lot next door, $28/day, I think. Taxis frequently come by, and can be arranged at the front desk. The business center consists of 3 computers in the lobby. They are at standing level with couches near them. I brought a chair over, which didn't seem to be a problem. There is a nice and fairly large fitness center in the basement, where the ice machine and vending machines are also located. The rooms are compact, as you'd expect in NYC. They were very plush, immaculate, and had upscale furnishings and bedding. Two doubles fit, and still allowed room for a desk, table, and tv area. There is no view to speak of, except for from the top floor (ask for it, if you're a PC member). The price was great; about half as much as most of the other hotels in NYC. I don't know why, and I'm certainly not complaining! Though we have family a short train ride away, we've decided that this hotel is so reasonable and wonderful that we'll always stay here instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain for a NYC hotel”
Reviews.Author: GrrlDetective
Reviews.Content: I don't usually stay in hotels in NYC, because I usually stay at my friend's apartment. But I needed a room for one night because of some scheduling conflicts. I got a great deal on this room and the location was ideal, just a few blocks from Penn Station. The staff was great. I got there around noon and they were able to let me check in right away. I had to very quickly get back to Penn Station to take a train to Long Island, so I was most grateful to them. The room was nice, clean and comfortable. I don't recall there being any sort of street noise. I believe all Holiday Inn Expresses have free internet and breakfast, which makes for a great bargain. If, for some reason, I again find myself needing a room in NYC, I will certainly consider this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, Will Definitely Be Returning!”
Reviews.Author: ZoeV81
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn @ Maddison Square Garden was one of the best stays in NYc I have had. I have stayed at many hotels in the city and this one was the best location and service for the money. Times Square, Herald Square, the Empire State Building and Chelsea are all within walking distance. So is Central Park if you don't mind a bit more of a stroll. If your more in the mood for taking the subway to get where you need to go, you can jump on within a block or 2 in either direction. Only a few minutes ride to Times Square and from there you can catch the subway to just about anywhere you could want to go. The hotel itself is in great condition. The rooms were big enough to have 2 queen size beds and my sister was still able to sleep on the floor in between them. The hotel was ok with having a 5th person in the room, but was just unable to provide a cot due to fire regulations. There is a nice continental breakfast in the morning, so if your on a budget it saves you having to pay for breakfast. I would definitely stay here again, and would reccomend it to anyone wanting to stay in the city. Oh yeah, there is also free wi-fi and a fitness room if your interested.

Reviews.Title: “Get to Breakfast Early”
Reviews.Author: N_and_F
Reviews.Content: New York hotels within the range of the 'average' traveller are expensive with small rooms. Bottom line. The Holiday Inn Express was reasonably priced with decent sized rooms and incl. breakfast. Breakfast is quite literally a bun fight. GET THERE EARLY or you will be waiting aimlessly for a table and the food will be well and truely picked over. That being said, it's great value for NYC and a nice quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Tones11
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a week in September. Rooms are small but clean and bed are comfy. Gary the Manager was F-A-B-U-L-O-U-S!!! The best I have ever encountered!
